hqzIytKluvjfYdPpAqqAwg.text: I'm writing this review after returning 2 days later. I had leftovers yesterday, so I am technically eating Bae Bae 3 days in a row.  On Monday I had the build your own plate. I chose tofu meatballs in a mushroom curry gravy and glass noodles. It came with squash tempura, salad, and cucumber kimchi. The meatballs were the tastiest vegan concoction I have ever had. The kimchi was so good, a tad sweet rather than sour, which I liked. And the tempura was perfectly crispy and delicious. I had enough to eat for dinner the next day.   Today I ordered the tofu kimbap with miso soup. It also came with the salad and tempura. The tofu kimbap has a nice plum sauce on it. I do wish it was cut in small pieces. It was difficult to eat delicately. But who am I kidding? I don't care.   The service was great, too! You order at the counter, where a super nice guy explains the menu and specials and there are displays of the food so you can see what you are ordering. There is no tipping, but there is a jar collecting for the humane society in lieu of tips.   The restaurant itself is small and is probably more conducive to take out, but it is quite cute and quaint if you decide to eat in.   I only come to the 'burgh on business, but I will be returning to try all the items on each visit. Bookmarked as a Pittsburgh fav in my yelp app.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean Taco Tuesday! Korean Fried Chicken Taco, Short Rib Taco,  Tempura, Pineapple Salsa
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu Kimbap, salad, tempura.

q2TIHRzUHICIiWC8tIDS0A.text: I have been watching this space since The Umbrella Cafe left and was happy to see something new in the space. The decor is the same bright airy decor with a front counter showing the available dishes. A few sides like glass noodle and rice, followed by proteins of beef, pork, chicken and vegetarian options, followed by extras like kimchi and crab salad. You create a meal from those options and they also have tea and coffee.   I have to say that I was really hopeful but not impressed by this place. The service was great and I was greeted with a smile. The restaurant was clean and full but I did not wait long.   However, the food was on par with your basic run of the mill Asian buffet food. It was lukewarm to start and the glass noodle dish was barely spiced. The bulgogi was uninspired and had a gummy texture. I was really looking forward to this dish as I had great bulgogi from the Mr bulgogi food truck the week prior. This was not even close. Its as if they used less spice to appeal to taste and I understand that. It could also be the lunch rush and I will go back again later in the day to give them another chance but this was not better than a panda express.   I was really hopeful that this would bring traditional Korean to downtown and they could get there but right now they are missing the mark.

GFVoVEeo4E5cOoOfOfBMAA.text: One of my favorite places in Pittsburgh. Definitely a go to spot when I need some good, quick food. Really wonderful, healthy, Korean options. And if you want to splurge, get the cheese wontons!

pUxC2k_ExhNy88UvrIAnkA.text: I was happy to see this place listed on Happy Cow as a vegan restaurant, but had to hurry as it was 7 pm and they closed at 8 pm. Good thing I stayed on Smallman Street and this was within walking distance. Parking downtown can be a nightmare and expensive to boot.   The restaurant is rather small so you order and pay at the counter. The gentleman behind the counter was extremely pleasant, explaining their specials and the sides that I can choose from the "Build a bowl" concept, which I opted for. My side was a seaweed salad. Never had it so thought I would try it.   Delivery of the food was very quick and the price not too bad. It was served in a cardboard container so you can quickly leave if a fire breaks out or some other catastrophe so I appreciated that. The plastic utensils were flimsy enough to be safe on any flight so no need to worry about stabbing anyone with the knife as it bent as I cut my tofu into smaller cubes.   The food was very good and plentiful. The seaweed was interesting. Would I get it again...maybe after a couple of glasses of wine. Not that it was bad, it was just too oceanic for me. I ate it anyway.   Overall, I loved the scene and the food so I would certainly go back again.

uJ804V4s14ALy_9k54P4oQ.text: Incredible vegan food. My mom and I went in here starrrrrving with high expectations and empty, empty stomachs. The cashier helped us navigate the menu, provided suggestions, but guided our our taste palettes.  The inside is a little instagram dream, succulents and bright blue walls. The outdoor seating is adorable, topped with a gazebo-esque frame coated with plants, and little little tables and chairs.   The food - simply amazing. The tofu was so well done. A vegetarian's little dream.

daLHgoMi6Wd-I-ixoZ522g.text: I stopped by here for dinner before a concert since I wanted to try it outside of the business lunch rush. I had the tofu with plum sauce, which I was a bit skeptical of at first - but the flavor really shines through and the texture of the tofu was amazing.   It is very difficult to balance crispness and a soft center in tofu, but this was worlds apart from the store-bought blocks of bean mush I'm used to having. The side salad was also very tasty and the sharp edge on the sauce took hold of the flavor, which is really what you want with raw vegetables.

CioCZ9UHgdJI_8wAju4oNw.text: Bae Bae's kitchen is one of my favorite places to have asian food. I always get the meal box that consists of a protein choice, staple (salad or noodles) and a side dish. The best part of Bae Bae's kitchen is the protein offerings, I have had both the bulgogi beef and the fried chicken. Both tasted delicious and had pretty good serving sizes. Additionally, the sides such as fried veggies and glass noodles as a base make for a very delicious combo. It is also worth noting they are unique sauces that complement their protein such as honey wasabi sauce and plum sauce. The one drawback to Bae Bae's is that it can get a little pricey but nothing more than $15-20. Overall, wonderful place.

fVW_WIXBIpBwk2aJKq4H3Q.text: - Amazing atmosphere  - On the go type of food  - Large portions  It gets relatively pack during peak hours && they have free WiFi

KAUDYytMX3HcOWV32Jr8Xw.text: Really tasty food,  quickly prepared.  Nice environment.  Recommend for a quick lunch.  I got the noodles with marinated beef and kimchi side!!

ouYpqVTop-XqT1Qff3pSZA.text: First of all, how cute is the name? Second of all, how awesome is it that there is finally a Korean restaurant downtown?   I visited with a few coworkers a few weeks after they opened. Not sure if staff were still learning, but the service was extremely slow during our visit. The space is really small with only about four tables and at one point, the line circled the entire place where the end of the line was right at the beginning! Anyhow, I was willing to overlook this if the food was good. I got the beef with noodles and I thought it was pretty decent. The flavor was mild, but still quite tasty. While it wasn't the best I've had, it also definitely was not the worst. I would definitely stop back!

9nNYC6oAIiJiDKs01kMA-Q.text: The food is great but I was disappointed that they didn't have actual Korean red sauce and used sriracha instead.  The space is very cool and we'll decorate. A perfect place to grab lunch and either take it back to the office or sit down. Bonus that it's an assembly line order so it's nice and quick and you're not wasting your lunch break waiting for the food rather than taking the time to enjoy it.

pnD080-1LwRIed3SAgWOgg.text: I was excited to try bae bae's because they had Korean fried chicken. They did not disappoint! I loved the cream cheese wontons with spicy mayo. Also the honey wasabi dipping sauce was the perfect balance of spicy and tangy.

mKJLH5tkghVmi9BFY1Vg9A.text: I liked it! Appreciated as a gluten free eater I could get the rice and chicken. I liked the ambiance, but it was a slow process to order and get our food. I was excited about the sweet potato fries, but as a gluten free eater I could enjoy them due to the tempura. Also, the restaurant had placed a large glass jug right in the foot path of one of the tables, which I didn't appreciate.

LwOVQRjBVOQ1P2Q8ndJB0A.text: Really delicious and unique!! The glass noodles are my favorite and the meats taste amazing. Also, they have a unique choices of sides which are also really good!

5ClU8dVk2WOXoh21g2QO-A.text: I went here for lunch today because of the Yelp reviews.  Upon arriving, the line was backed up. This to me was a sign that this was a popular place and the food was good. However, the long line was due to a backup in food production.  I waited with my friends for about 15 minutes, however it was worth it. The food was delicious, and everyone I went with agreed with me. I got the spicy chicken plate with the milk tea with boba.  If I were to come back here, I would need to plan this accordingly to lunch rush.

B4IBLexjbGRcoXRM7Zdu0w.text: Great food in a fast-casual setting.   Was very excited to check this place out - it looked very nice on the internet and I'm always looking for something on the less expensive side to eat while downtown.  We showed up at noon on a Saturday, right as they were opening. They were running late, so they gave us a portion of tempura on the house to eat while we waited - love that service!  I had glass noodles and tofu with plum sauce. I enjoyed both but the highlight for me was that they have vegetarian cucumber kimchi! Loved it!  Overall had a great experience and will definitely be back again.

LA_8doX1VOpeDdDW7gZefg.text: Delish, fresh food. Don't be put off by the line at lunchtime - it moves quickly. The KFC (Korean Fried Chicken) is crunchy and comes with a honey habanero sauce that I would buy if they would bottle.

sbBy1SR9vp2aFrmS5YIW1A.text: So delicious! From the kimchi to the beef, tofu and even the atmosphere, Bae Bae's Kitchen is one of my new favorite places. Plus, they're pretty quick and reasonably priced.

LxgQG77tyrg-YQImzTb1lw.text: Bae Bae's has delicious, healthy food in generous portions! The staff is friendly and the atmosphere is beautiful. However, they need to improve their process to filling orders / relaying orders to the kitchen because it is currently not a positive experience.  I have only been to Bae Bae's twice - once during lunch hour, and once in the evening when the restaurant was very quiet. Both times my order was processed long after people who paid after me, and the second time one item from my order was missed, so the rest of my food got cold while I awaited the last item. Both times I waited 20+ minutes for my food.  Normally I'm pretty accepting of this type of mix up in casual restaurants, but for the price point at Bae Bae's I would expect much better service. They did apologize and gave us a complimentary add-on, but that does not make up for the majority of my $50-dollar 2-person meal being cold and sitting out for almost half an hour before I could eat it.   Hopefully they can evaluate their order process so their service can be as good as their food!

DH4emyuHiqq8W0KVZiNsWw.text: This place was the highlight of my trip to Pittsburgh. First of all, the interior design is ADORABLE- super cozy, lots of greenery, a general rustic feel.   The thai tea boba I ordered might be the best I've had in life- it was so creamy, fresh, and the right amount of sweet without being overbearingly so.   I ordered KFC and tempura veggies with my plate.  The KFC was super crispy and the chicken was so tender and juicy!! Tempura veggies did not disappoint, either.   Everything was delicious, and everyone was super friendly. Thank you Bae Bae's Kitchen for being a True bae.

N92xi3mHIn8s6Uv42fMhrA.text: Next time we are in Pittsburgh, we are coming back here. So delicious. Thumbs up to whoever takes care of the plants here too. Nice work!

cjKPc0TCwqcA0q5AU6BSYA.text: This is a cute little place in downtown. Their vegetable tempura is amazing and so are the glass noodles. Get the cheese wontons on the side, you won't regret it!

Gyw13CNp9XAIDMtebiq0ig.text: My highly anticipated meal at BaeBae's truly lived up to expectations. I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken and it was amazing. The chicken was so juicy and cooked to perfection. Along side that was an array of flavors, greens, and their amazing noodles - so fresh, and fairly quick. It was the perfect amount of food to have a truly satiating but not uncomfortable meal. I would recommend Bae Bae's to anyone. Another thing to note, especially for this place, is the cozy interior and friendly employees. I will, without a doubt, be back.

jGqA0eDZGDjO5EtBRZolRA.text: I wish we had one back home because this place is AMAZING! Came in for lunch during a weekday and wasn't too busy. The place is quite small, but they do have more seating in the back. It's set up like a qdoba/mod pizza, but Korean food. You pick a protein, then rice/noodles, then a small side like kimchi or cucumber kimchi. It also came with couple of these like fried sweet potato and a salad, which were both delicious! Everything tasted SO fresh and yummy! Really, everything was SO good!   It seems they do change menus... and the lunch and dinner are different also.   The atmosphere is beautiful inside with tons of plants/flowers. They also don't accept tips, instead donations for dogs...which is another great thing about this place. I will DEF stop in anytime in Pittsburgh!

I keep dreaming (and drooling) about my next meal here.

NKlqDgdyymC8ENTh-h9dhw.text: Not to much to say that hasn't already been written.  Rather small with a short line to order and a short wait for our food.  Friendly staff and lots of plants in the window.  My KFC with glass noodles and cucumber kimchi was good.  The chicken was moist and tasty but nothing special.  Really enjoyed the noodles and kimchi.  A good place for lunch when in town.

W0kGrLngaRfZbjpemW45oA.text: Probably the best meal I will ever eat in Pittsburgh. Every person I bring to Bae Bae's loves it. The food is delicious especially the Korean fried chicken, bulgogi beef, glass noodles and vegetable tempura. Everything we try here, exceeds my expectations.  The atmosphere of the restaurant is fun, bright and bubbly. And the staff is super friendly and welcoming. By far the best restaurant in town.

UB5Hhyj4iDXppkBd_CulSA.text: I can declare the my first visit to Bae Bae's Kitchen will not be my last! The cashier, Daniel, (he made me feel like a welcomed guest, every time a went to talk to him he called me by name) guided me on the different choices. I decided to create my own plate. You start with either: rice, noodles (clear) or salad. 2nd pick a protein: organic grass braised short ribs, Korean fried chicken, organic bbq pork belly, or organic crispy tofu. 3rd pick a side dish: kimchi, seaweed salad or sweet potatoes (thinly sliced, tempura battered and fried)  My choices were: noodles, chicken, and the sweet potatoes. The meal came with a tossed salad that had a mildly flavored chili dressing. There was also a wasabi sauce ( this will clear your sinuses for sure) on the side to dip your chicken in.   I want to describe this food as Korean comfort food! The two large pieces of chicken was tender and crispy and so were the multiple pieces of sweet potatoes. The noodles were lightly seasoned and a perfect accompaniment to the rest of the meal and the salad was a good balance to the meal.   The meal was well worth the price and so fulfilling!

ojvrrJVlS2pH7yw19WwWPA.text: I go out of my wae wae for Bae Bae's Korean Fried Chicken. Everything else is fine, too, and you really can't go wrong with some noodles, a chicken cutlet, and some kimchi. Whatever they have pickled during your visit is worth it. But I don't care about anything as much as I care about the Korean Fried Chicken.  I apply to jobs downtown when I'm in my feelings and I prae prae to get a hit so I could eat Bae Bae every dae dae.

wqb2nFNqH4yjg6xi0JQh6Q.text: Initially was going for Mexican food. It was a blessing in disguise that that place was closed, because it led me here!!   Great customer service, amazing made-to-order meal, and relaxing ambiance! Was not disappointed in my choice of noodles, tofu, and kimchi side! Also got the milk tea that wasn't too sweet!   Definitely recommend for an easy lunch meal!

fJRfe7flJpCwfBq_hJrzuw.text: I had delivery brought to me from here. It was absolutely delicious. It was nothing like I expected. It was authentic with extremely high-quality ingredients. A very nice portion. I also had a Vietnamese coffee it was incredible

fEZIoo17U6WgT-n__prA8Q.text: Cool little place that is popular with younger crowd. Good quality and quantity of food.

6-ibDZWQv9RyuUe7LiNLHA.text: Yesterday I finally did it. I was going to meet a friend for dinner and I said we should come here. It has been on my radar for months and when I finally have the chance of being downtown this was a place I knew I had to pick. I was really excited when my friend agreed with me and we made a date for Bae Bae's Kitchen. After hearing all the hype from all the other reviewers and from my friends who live downtown I was excited. And I will say they lived up to the hype. When I walked in they were just opening for their dinner at 5 PM. Since my friend was not there yet the man behind the counter was kind enough to explain, in incredible detail, all of the choices that were in front of me for dinner. He was so friendly and incredibly  thorough it was great.   The atmosphere inside was very homey. I love all the plants on the walls and in the window. I will say that it was a bit chilly inside but not so much that it was distracting.  So when my friend got there we went up to order. And I got the glass noodles, with the Korean Fried Chicken, the seaweed salad, and the Bulgogi Kimbap. The noodles and kimbap both came with a salad and the kimbap also came with miso soup.   I have to say that everything that I ate was amazing. The orders come out pretty quickly and the food was great. There was even enough for me to save for lunch the next day. Any time that you go out and they give you enough food for lunch as well as your meal at the time is good in my book. The sauces that came with the Korean Fried Chicken, Wasabi honey sauce, was the most amazing thing that I've had on chicken in a long time. The chicken was also fried to perfection with a delicious panko breading. The chicken also was organic so you can take that how you may. All I know is it was delicious. We also got some of the vegetable tempura. This was also very good. It was a mixture of sweet potatoes and squash. Again fried to perfection with a lovely panko breading. I dipped it in my honey Wasabi sauce yummy.  I look forward to coming back to try more on their menu. This place really does live up to its hype. I will come back just because the service was so very friendly. The menu is also great and I cannot wait to try more things on it.

WDmqkNK6iPC6yE--mZ7GgA.text: Bae Bae's is a great addition to the downtown food scene. I had the pork cutlets with the noodles - both of which were fantastic.

5ayOKyDcdYgzzseWEFnAlw.text: Went with a group of friends during Light Up Night. Overall: 4/5. Details below.  Decor: 5/5 for a dainty coffee house style. Food is displayed right in front of you as you order, like Chipotle. Music: 5/5 for being on point with classics (Spotify playlist- "Songs to Sing in the Shower") Food presentation: 4/5 organized in a to go box Flavor: 4/5 Daeji was alright, wasn't spicy as expected. KFC was flavorful and a bit salty. Vietnamese coffee wasn't as sweet as expected, but is strong. Thai iced tea was a bit watered down.  Price: 3/5 a bit too much for a college student's wallet. Service: 5/5 very polite and pleasant employees. Bathrooms: 4/5 really spacious.  Would I come back again? No, unless I was bringing a friend from out of town to try out Pittsburgh foods.   Really pleasant place that was a bit expensive, but I enjoyed my time there.

PanPz6mi61dvvPcqrj7ygg.text: Not a ton of options but everything I at was bomb. Hella vegan options. Yelp is dumb for trying to police how short my review is. I ate good food and had no problem. Eat here if you are in Pitt looking for healthy options

5CkTamf6NCADNMbFPhCyAw.text: Delicious! This was a great way to introduce our kids to Korean cuisine and it was a healthy, trendy, city atmosphere which is great. It was clean and healthy. They even brought us out free sweet potato tempura as we were eating, just to be nice.

Ukep2kvaf7nSx3qukn1Ehw.text: Wonderful food amazing and friendly staff. This place has become a weekly treat. I have not once been disappointed everything is flavorful and made well.

Eb6rlzYjOPV8exrrHxNQ5g.text: The crispy tofu was amazing. Very close to convention center and local hotels. Quick and friendly service.

srNBpuf2gURhldDAx-f4ew.text: Great spot for a quick lunch for a reasonable price.  The food is really good and you get plenty of it.

A_pRVbj1vCIg_Uz94-dbSg.text: Drove up from Wash PA with some foodie friends based on the yelp reviews. I was not disappointed. Honestly not the best Korean food I've ever had, but really fresh and the atmosphere and staff were so pleasant. I was NOT excited by the price of my bubble tea - $5.35! But I'll definitely be back.

XW8bgSF1dEN067KEYOzY9w.text: Love Bae Bae's for a lunch spot!! Unique and creative food! They use flavors and items that you won't experience anywhere else! Cool vibe and staff was extremely friendly!

OVaeuX5DGF0BEgK37NZ32A.text: Ordered the Spicy Stirfry Chicken with glass noodles - the meal was delicious & prepared very quickly. The ambiance of the restaurant is relaxed - I highly recommend anyone visiting Pittsburgh to stop by Bae Bae's! The Kimchi is a must!

lhfp84UqtA5gNGYpq-CwHg.text: Excellent. Healthful-ish Korean cuisine-based meals served up with a smile. For the uninitiated, the ordering process isn't too awky, but might be made less so by speaking to the counter person around the side of the glass divider, as opposed to trying to speak thru or over it. Just read the notes on the blackboard and you'll be in there like swimwear. I might be as white as rice but their Napa cabbage kimchi was some of the best I've ever enjoyed. It was light, crisp, tangy, zesty and tart. My vegetarian dining partner and I agreed that if this place was near where we lived, we would both happily enjoy a meal or three from this place every week - guilt free.

m1-lVaEYW8CyE4tpueT1HQ.text: Came with co-workers because it was the only place that could take a large group at the time. We were initially not sure if we'd like it based on the menu but we still went. What a pleasant surprise. The food was amazing: much better than expected. I thoroughly enjoyed the Korean fried chicken with the wasabi sauce (sweet and spicy). Everybody enjoyed the sweet potato tempura: they even brought extra for us to eat. For the price, you get your monies worth, which is a whole lot of food. Cool spot for casual dining or take out.

BJ40e8B0XIJWzSL5H_zBnQ.text: Having just moved back from Pittsburgh from LA, I was dreading the heaviness of the food in this city.  I was pumped to hear about Bae Bae's but feared it wouldn't meet my expectations.   I was wrong. The food was exactly what I was hoping for.  I would best describe it as LA modern Korean--fresh clean food, not perfectly authentic, but very clear where the roots came from.   Most of all, their banchan (side dishes) were on point. The best kimchi I've ever had in Pittsburgh (there isn't that much). Most importantly, they use the correct Persian cucumber for their cucumber kimchi which keep the crispness better.   I'll also say, the service was very thoughtful and intentional, something that I find is often lacking in Pittsburgh restaurants.

e_gkGhYa5UGuG521iL8ChQ.text: Hands down some of the best chicken I've ever had. The staff was super nice and even gave us some free samples of the Thai iced tea, which was amazing. Will definitely be coming back!

bbQiMTb_mEKa7_G708FFfg.text: This place is a hidden gem!   The Korean fired chicken will leave you wanting more. Everything is so fresh and tasty. It's pretty much first come first serve so go early because they will run out!   Their Kimchi is a family recipe and it is so yummy! This place is small and family owned. Everyone is so friendly and the vibe there is chill.  You cannot go wrong with any of their offerings. Go and go early, you will not be disappointed!

hePod2Eu_c2FAsSm1W49rA.text: Delicious and generous portions! Friendly faces behind the counter and a very cozy place to dine. I tried the bulgogi and the glass noodles and it did not disappoint. Great spot!

BJsZtXme9mBGekdDQHdI6A.text: My husband and I were in Pittsburgh for a conference over the weekend. We love different types of cuisine and we felt very lucky to find this little Korean restaurant! The food was clean, the flavors were great and the people were super nice! Other little thing: you don't tip but you can leave a donation for an animal shelter! We recommend this place a lot !!

w_WZPiTCtzYPr9LfA80ZyA.text: Came back to celebrate a friend coming into town.  We were first in line and the staff was quick to take our order and friendly.  After ordering it took 15-20 mins for each of our orders to show.  Two of us ordered Pork Belly.  The pork belly was no more than thin cuts of rubbery bacon.  If you are looking for quality food check else where or maybe give it a try....

u-Gi95Hrlpe6cvNcRUz6mA.text: Great place to get a quick quality dinner you won't feel guilty about. The BBQ beef is my absolute favorite. Definitely a step above your typical quick take out place, but this place is still fast and convenient. You can taste the quality in their ingredients.

hhXoNwNA8r44TPRwxs0Lrw.text: super cute ambiance and amazing food! not a super big place but super cute to go inside full of plants and cute things! the food is enough for 2 to share - big portions! love this place

etv-fOw31l08pY5SsxZcmg.text: Delicious, unique dining experience in downtown Pittsburgh. It was my first time at this dining spot the host was so friendly and helpful. He explained how you build your own plate. I chose a base of crystal noodles, protein of fried organic chicken breast and potatoes Salad side. They also give you fried sweet potatoes and salad. The food was fresh and delicious. I asked if I could taste the pork and that was delicious as well. The atmosphere is warm and inviting. Modern, clean and they support the Humane Society which I really like. I would recommend this place for lunch and great for take out too.

JdN5lHJfV687ZmpJgunZuQ.text: Yes. Just yes. I love having yet another fast casual lunch option downtown, and I love it even more for being of an Asian variety.  I popped in today right as they opened for lunch, and the guy behind the counter was very patient and friendly with me as he gave me a rundown of the ordering process and food options.  I opted for the "special" fried rice, the KFC, a side of kimchee, and they threw in some complimentary sweet potato tempura which was so so good.  So good. Everything. So good.  And it's not just tasty food, but a sweet atmosphere and great music. (90s R&B at the time of my visit.)  Putting this in regular rotation on my lunch dining options...

pX9iP68f3DvuvV8HIcBTJw.text: Quality ingredients made fresh, incredible dining room makes a great first impression.  Tips are 100% donated to non-profit efforts.  I am going back for more and you should too.

v9h79u6nfXoCrOmfASKpzA.text: We come here annually for the furry event and knowing this place will be here every year excites me. We tried the kfc and the tofu for lunch on Friday. Both were fantastic. The next day we went for dinner and had the beef and a fish special, again both delivering an even better experience the second time. We dined in tonight, the atmosphere, lighting, and music are all just great. We look forward to lunch tomorrow and for years to come! A True treasure of Pittsburgh!

05hKt9FO-pFRTumdQZdZdw.text: I walk past Bae Bae's each day on my way to work, and today I finally stopped in to try it for lunch.  I ordered the KFC (Korean Fried Chicken), rice, and tempura fried veggies.  Everything was remarkably delicious.  The tempura veggies were like candy.  The chicken was perfectly cooked.  The honey-wasabi sauce they put on the side was outrageously good.  I raved about it to all my co-workers, and now I'm raving about it to you.  It might be my new favorite place for lunch downtown.

Yt36EC8ntNLMAfRdv2cKeg.text: This is another place I was excited about.  Ever since the previous restaurant there closed (Umbrella Cafe, a favorite of mine since I moved in), the empty storefront made me sad to walk by.  I had been monitoring the space for a while and knew a place called Bae Bae's Kitchen was opening up, but it had been hard to find much information about it.  I had no idea it had opened until I walked by today.  Korean food is one of my favorites, so I was thrilled to try it.  I had a plate with the special egg and onion fried rice and bulgogi with one side dish (I chose seaweed salad) for $13.  I was also given a cup of kimchi and some miso soup and Thai iced tea.  All the food was delicious.  I especially liked the bulgogi.  The service here was very friendly, even when an influx of people came in.  The ordering was convenient... you just go up to the counter where they display the options for your plates (or grab and go items such as kimbap).  If I had one complaint about my experience, it would be that the pork belly advertised on the menu was not available today.  But it is understandable, as they are just starting out.  I will definitely be back.  This is a worthy successor to the Umbrella Cafe.

XmAn3e6Cc59__Asf4aEn9Q.text: Bae Bae's Kitchen is sooooooooo good! Soo fresh! Super awesome for vegan vegetarian and those who love the meat! Super cute and everyone super nice

223X2gWTeP3nrTcMkKa7Rw.text: Really good food and friendly staff! The dining area is a very calm setting! Highly recommended

Iuod_PZC0TwWWqFF3PEY5g.text: Great addition to the neighborhood! Tofu and glass noodles hit the spot. The only downside was all the extra greens on the side. They were a little overwhelming. Worth a try!

EhCKDreoZXpOorVGv1bkRQ.text: Fabulous add to the downtown Pittsburgh lunch options!  Lovely staff cooking scratch-made Korean family recipes.  A very approachable menu with well-explained items.  Had the glass noodles with vegetables, their Korean fried chicken (a boneless cutlet with a panko-style breading) and plum sauce, and a side of their kimchi, which I was assured was their grandmother's recipe.  Everything was delicious, light, fresh and not at all greasy.  The bulgogi and fried tofu looked delicious as well, and I can't wait to go back.  Seating is limited, but the takeout packaging is excellent.  This is an exciting new add with delicious food.  Can't wait to go back!

dAiNsNfK_GeH4ZcI8MEZFA.text: Cute and charming downtown spot for Korean food. This was my first Korean restaurant experience and I enjoyed everything! The crispy tofu was delicious (and I normally don't like tofu too much), and the fried chicken was good too. It's Korean food made accessible (pick a base, pick a protein, pick a side).

_xDzJIk4OmNGoZwJgOqzTw.text: Amazing organic Korean food. Expertly cooked by friendly staff. You can mix and match your grain/veggies with protein, just like a Chipotle type restaurant. I HIGHLY recommend you try it if you're in the area and looking for something new. Just fantastic food! The kimchi sides are spot on as well.

We were so excited to learn that another Korean/Asian fusion restaurant opened in Pittsburgh and this place did not disappoint. Love the fact that their food's organic, all natural, and locally sourced. Everything was seasoned well and the sweet potato tempura batter was light and crispy. We will definitely be returning.

Oa697EtANGwrogZeIjceyA.text: I'm not a vegan but I had an amazing vegan meal here! The tofu is incredible and the plum sauce goes well with it. The ingredients are really fresh!!! Plus it's very affordable to have a healthy meal.

SYwZ9MpvRsaNKjbYMvIN9g.text: Some friends recommended I go here & I got the Thai iced tea with tapioca boba & it was so good! They were very considerate to ask whether I had any dairy allergies & let me know that one of the items I ordered contained shellfish. 5NXosDJbVpD3CCJ_WQ2h5Q.text: This is my favorite Korean restaurant in the Pittsburgh area!! No need to travel to NY or DC or Chicago anymore for truly awesome Korean cuisine!! Their foods are authentic, clean, and absolutely delicious!!

mkuvMXxHnYuKRU2GE36DIw.text: Yum!  You choose a base (rice, noodles, or salad), a protein (beef, chicken, pork belly, tofu) and a side (kimchi, cucumber kimchi, etc).  I had the pork belly on salad with kimchi.  Delish!  Cute atmosphere.  Wish I had come earlier in the day to try their Vietnamese coffee or Thai ice tea.

U3NaFlTjLUjE37rFMlrEQw.text: This was a great find near my hotel, where options were limited for take out food. The staff was super friendly and helpful in explaining how the menu worked. I had their beef bulgogi with their glass noodles and veggie tempura. The food was super tasty and offered something different than your typical sandwiches and salads. xVXzZsKLuRlLIjexr76x2g.text: The food was delicious and plentiful and relatively inexpensive. Great value. Will definitely go again.

8qaqbmCiIAibGJeCCeHHWA.text: Love Bae Baes! I was trying to get this cute girl to Have dinner with me there, but it's complicated!  So even take out is super quick and easy! Great service too!

JRS5dKQc_d2oPUX4enZ1Wg.text: I can't believe it took me as long as it did to give this place a try. One of my health-conscious coworkers frequents Bae Bae's on days he allows himself the treat of going out to eat for lunch, and I am very strict with myself about packing my lunch. I decided it was time to treat myself, too, and we went to Bae Bae's on a sunny Friday afternoon.  We walked in and got right in line. I love the cute terrariums and the bar you can sit at in the front of the restaurant. Places that are well-lit with natural lighting have a warm, comfortable feel about them and you get lots of natural light here.  Ordering here is super simple and you start with a choice of protein. You can choose from beef, pork belly, Korean fried chicken (KFC), and crispy tofu. Next, you choose two sides. Your first choice is between rice, salad greens or glass noodles, and the next choice is between tempura veggies, seaweed salad, or kimchi. You can get some sides of Kim Bob (almost like sushi but with any protein choice and veggies rolled up in rice and seaweed) or a daily special as an extra if you'd prefer that. One of my favorite things about the menu is that it's organic! This is a great place to go if you want something that tastes good, is good for you, and is affordable.  I'm always one to opt for chicken over beef and pork, but I like tofu, too. This time I decided on the KFC because my friend recommended it, and the pictures I've seen made it look incredible. For my sides I got the glass noodles and seaweed salad, which are two of my favorite things. You get a small side salad no matter what, so I still got my serving of veggies in! The chicken was perfectly crispy, and each box comes with two HUGE chicken strips with wasabi honey sauce. I'm a self-proclaimed condiment fanatic, and the honey wasabi was uniquely delicious in all the right ways.  Portion size here was also part of my decision to give Bae Bae's five stars as the box I got for about $12 was enough for me to get 2 solid meals out of it. I got a box exactly like the one I got to bring home to my boyfriend and he also loved everything about it. Needless to say, we'll be coming back to Bae Bae's, and the convenient downtown location makes this place a great choice for lunch or dinner.

FEl52HXkjunL1RrG-inTSQ.text: We stopped here during a trip to Pittsburgh, based on the great reviews and proximity to our hotel. I'm so glad we did...the food was excellent. The host/cashier (sad I didn't catch his name) was friendly and helpful in choosing just the right dishes. I had the KFC with wasabi honey sauce (so good!) My daughter loved the steamed dumplings. I wish I was a local so I could eat here more often.

tftE_uyBr9MVXY0GrfkDHQ.text: Wow was this food amazing.  Super fast high quality food.  If you like Korean food or even if you aren't sure about Korean food you must try this place.  A little pricey for lunch about $15 for bulgogi rice tempura vegetables and a small side salad.  I can't even put into words the high quality of the food here.  I will definitely be back time and time again.

PTHLDBs1yS_HvYsAyc1mRg.text: OVERALL: this is the definition of Korean fusion done right. Great tasting bulgogi and rice, with authentic kimchi and a healthy salad on the side. Cute environment and super friendly service. A bit expensive for the portion size, though - $13 for bulgogi.   I was excited to come here due to the reviewers on Yelp loving Bae Bae's. I came right as it opened at 11:30am, and was surprised at how green and lovely the ambience was. There were so many plants in the restaurant, creating a calm and serene natural atmosphere. It was also very colorful and aesthetically-pleasing.   The food itself was great. The bulgogi was marinated perfectly, albeit a tad too sweet for me. It had a distinct Korean flavor, which made me extremely happy, because I'm usually not a fan of fusion food. The kimchi was also well-made and fresh, and the rice was good too - sticky and warm. I usually dislike salads, but was able to finish all of my salad at Bae Bae's. It complemented the flavor of the bulgogi very well, and the crisp, fresh vegetables was a great contrast to the heavy, flavorful meat. The meal left me 110% full, yet refreshed at the same time.   I will definitely come back here again! As I said before, it's kind of expensive for the portion size, but it's an amazing option for healthy Korean fusion food that manages to keep its authentic flavor as well.

HNMaqE6yipTuOlbVjZA9Jw.text: I'd been eyeing this place for a while and I finally decided to come on a Monday afternoon. We arrived right before the lunch hour rush began and snagged the window table with a lovely view of the sunlight pouring through the spring leaves on the street. I'd highly recommend sitting there if you can, it was nice to feel the sun and take in the atmosphere of the hanging plants. There's additional seating in the back too, but I personally like natural lighting.  Not being too hungry, my friend and I decided to share the KFC as our main entree. I wanted to try their wings alone, but they were sold out of these at that point in the month. We got the noodles  and tempura veggies as a side. There was a wasabi sauce that accompanied it, but I asked for if there were any other ones and the guy at checkout kindly handed me a plum sauce. I personally enjoyed the plum sauce more than the wasabi one.   The food itself was really good. The combination of the fried parts with the crisp salad and cold noodles helped satisfy my craving. If I would go back and change something I might have gotten the beef instead of chicken to reduce the amount of oil, but it wasn't too overwhelming and I didn't feel heavy or gross after eating it. The chicken was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside, i kept wanting to take more bites. And to know that these ingredients have good origins also helped my conscious.  We also got ginger beer and bubble tea as drinks $4 each. They weren't the greatest compliments, or at least not worth their price. But it was a good experiment. I'd still go to chick n bubbly for my bubble tea.  Overall, I had high expectations going in and I believe that they were met. The ambiance, the food, the price, it was worth it for a fulfilling meal. Definitely would come back to try their wings when they're back in stock!

EmevDEWw0c_hc2uFdXoDqg.text: One of the best places to go for Korean in the 'burgh. If you don't know Korean food, the folks here will help you order what matches your palate. The food is fantastic, especially the Korean Fried Chicken. Everything is super fresh and tasty.

9Pbbq9L6WEs6Fxeerqw_8w.text: If I have one issue on Yelp, it's that 100% of my reviews thus far have been four stars. No variety what so ever. This review will be no exception.  I went to Bae Bae's Kitchen with a coworker for a late lunch on a Friday. It was moderately busy, but being a small restaurant, it fills up fast regardless.  To order at Bae Bae's, you pick a base, protein, and side. I chose stir-fried glass noodles, Korean fried chicken, and a cubed daikon kimchi. They also include a small side salad in your box (the box doubles as both a bowl and a take-out container). For a drink, I went with a Thai iced tea with tapioca balls. Including the tip, I paid $22, which seemed reasonable for a restaurant in the city that sits at the upper end of fast-casual dining.   The noodles were pretty good, the side salad was okay, but I was a bit disappointed by the Korean fried chicken. Some of my disappointment is my own fault, as I wasn't expecting the katsu-style fried chicken cutlets that were served, but rather a double fried bonchon-style chicken. The chicken, while well-cooked, wasn't very flavorful and left me wishing I had gotten the bulgogi like my coworker. My favorite part of the meal was actually the daikon kimchi, which smelled like a regurgitated garden salad, but was fresh and bright tasting with a satisfying, crunchy texture and slight spiciness.   Another redeeming aspect of Bae Bae's is the giant, street facing window, adorned with plants, lightbulbs and hanging, glass terrariums. Not only does it look nice, but it provides plentiful natural light.  All in all, I enjoyed my lunch at Bae Bae's. The food, on a whole, was pretty good and wasn't unreasonably expensive, and the inviting atmosphere is a reason to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

WbcnQUwmgYE3Hz2QQx5SmQ.text: A cute little Korean fusion restaurant located near the convention center. The decor was adorable, and even the covered eating area and front patio decor was placed and purchased with an eye for beauty.   Dishes are a little pricey but I had enough for leftovers. You choose a base, a protein, and a side for around $15.  I got the glass noodles, KFC (that's Korean fried chicken for noobs), and seaweed salad for the side.    They also have milk tea and boba but I decided against it.   The verdict: glass noodles were a little less cooked than I like but flavor was ok. The chicken patty was crispy but the seasoning did not feel authentic. The honey wasabi sauce that accompanied it is lovely though.   And I was most disappointed by the side. I was expecting green wakame with a bright dressing and got a red kelp with a heavier oil based dressing.  Maybe I should have asked before I ordered it without looking though.   Overall, a decent experience for Asian fusion in downtown Pittsburgh but not something I would crave.

FRu_3nR_Unc7CGjFmrpzmw.text: First time to try out. When I got to the restaurant I was excited to see that there was no line to wait on. Since most reviews I saw before coming is that there is always a line out the door. Walking in the ambiance of the place is very warm, welcoming and somewhat romantic. The place was very clean and The staff was very friendly.   I ordered a KFC "Korean fried chicken" for dine in. As the food was delivered to our table I was somewhat disappointed to see our food served in To go boxes since we were eating in. Maybe that's just they're style but it just wasn't what I was expecting. For the food itself, I must say it is the biggest disappointment of all. For a "fried chicken" dish, I expected there to be an actual bone in fried chicken. What it is a panko covered chicken breast fillet. There was no Korean flavor to the chicken itself and apparently no sort of seasoning at all. As in no salt and pepper. The dish was incredibly bland. That not even the kimchi or wasabi sauce (which was gross btw) can salvage it. Overall a very unpleasant dish.   If you're looking for an "instagramable" place then this is the place to go to but if ur looking for good and satisfying food then I suggest skipping.

7dj1nd5tbTJhkycBKFKQcA.text: Downtown Pittsburgh finally added a Korean restaurant to it's mix?? Color me surprised.  Scratch that... They added a delicious Korean restaurant to downtown Pittsburgh??? Holy grail!  This place had great food. I've been so tied up with work and social life I haven't had a chance to stop in to the new spots popping up all over our fair city. Pleased and proud to say I specifically made time for this place. How could I not. It's fast. It's casual. It's awesome. The location is great. The food is great. The staff were helpful and quick with any suggestions when asked.  For an american that has never had a chance to try real korean food, this was a superb treat. I will definitely be back to taste test more of the menu and bring some friends with me next time.

zxuB_SZbq2aGBBVchgsSbw.text: The customer service was wonderful! The KFC was tender on the inside and crispy in the outside. The kimchi was a medium spice level and the salad dressing was tasty.

MwVeMRsu6Tcg9XQsVL6v8A.text: Love the interior and location, and good space with a fun concept of ordering by choosing a grain, meat, and sides at a counter. The bulgogi was slightly too sweet, and the honey/wasabi sauce for the Korean Fried Chicken was far too sweet. Sides of cucumbers and Kim chi were quite nice, though together a meal runs a bit high at 13$. We will be back to try it out again.

Everything was really yummy and the service was fantastic - I came close to closing, but they were very kind and patient as I was choosing. Love the daikon kimchi and I even got a complimentary sweet potato tempura. Also love that they give back: leftover food goes to shelters and tips to Humane society. lGHIbArSskVDQjQrNgYckw.text: Oh. My. Goodness.  This place is great- really great. Great vibe, friendly staff, and the owners are kind really personable! Their front window is full of live plants, and their high ceilings and open concept was refreshing. I spoke with Ashley, the co-owner, and she was super sweet.  I didn't even get started with the food yet! To keep it short, the food is fresh to order, healthy, and tastes great! The spices and subtle sweets complimented each other, and the salad was a good balance to the bulgogi. Also- take the Kimchi pickles if they have them.  On. Point.  To top it off- they made special Fruity Pebbles Rice Krispies.. with gummy bears! Delicious, even though I had to break up eating it into two sessions to avoid a sugar rush.  Bottom line- if you are in the area, and are on the hunt for  a healthy and tasty meal with Korean inspiration- Go here, it was the best meal that I had in Pittsburgh! Good, fresh, "clean" food that doesn't taste "healthy".  If, for some reason, I'm ever in Pittsburgh again- I will make it back for another go!

0USeBp0czbgbpMq8vNsjWg.text: Said open till 3 but closed at 2 and I drove all this way how rude!!!!! Why did they have to do this and in pride.

jhBxvCN8HnR1ZBjDoVSHog.text: This place has been bookmarked for me since it opened. I went on sat night and walked 3 blocks in 9 degree weather. So worth it. Most positive food experience I have had in a long time. Was working down Liberty Ave trying to find it. No big signs but recognized the lights/plants from a photo from here. Went in and go to the counter. Super friendly staff explained how to order. Got the last Beef (went at 6:30 and sold out already) but was ok because the pork belly was equally as good. My sister said fried chicken was really good as well. The chicken was served with a wasabi/honey sauce-SO GOOD. No sure if you can ask for a side of it but it was delicious with the sweet potatoes. I would still recommend getting the beef first if they have it. Meals came out after 10-15 minutes. They don't look like much but are so filling. I had to take some home, but luckily tasted just as good the next day. The only disappointment was the overpriced tea/coffee. But I say it's worth a try if you never had Vietnamese coffee before. I can't wait to go back. It was that good.

G8C96mfRe7zt3EzSzOhmZw.text: Small high quality selection to choose. Everything taste fresh. We order pork belly and KFC with Thai tea. Overall good but hidden in downtown.

-uxccqdHE8zPwh95CU3iog.text: Beautiful, yet simple decor. Delicious food. Kind, helpful, and knowledgeable staff! Loved the beef with glass noodles and cucumber salad! My boyfriend got the fried chicken and loved it.  Also, we were given complementary tea while we waited for dinner service to begin. Very nice of them to think of the customer. Highly recommend. Good people, great food.

tBOHmgzZz4yTU2Ph1yZOaw.text: I am currently visiting Pittsburgh, PA, and I found Bae Bae's Kitchen on Yelp as a suggestion.  The service, selection of quality of food, the authenticity of the food I ordered, and the politeness of the staff was highly impressive and unbeatable.  Before I left the restaurant, I mentioned to two of the men working there, they should inform their manager that they will receive an excellent review from me on Yelp.  They were both delighted, and we departed all with smiles on our faces.

RxbFsN0IknduvCNdRSD4NQ.text: Really cool vibe in this place. The guy at the front who served us was very friendly and happy to gush about the food! Very good portion size and the Korean fried chicken is crisp and tasty. Fast casual and kids loved it!

DGOp_TUe9y1shREz0bAOdA.text: The food is delicious! Great portion size for cost. Really fresh and good quality, nutritious food. I have food allergies and they were very helpful with my food selection. Gf df friendly! Vegan options too! The tofu is the best I've had in Pgh! The staff were so warm and helpful :)

ePWW7vKZuSFVi5Rv_6KeMg.text: Delicious fresh food and the employees behind the counter were so nice! Highly recommend!

fDeJ-BgcnlTIunDyxn09Vw.text: I just flew into Pittsburgh for a conference and while I was in route to CVS to pick up some incidentals, I stumbled upon this place. The name sort of attracted me to walk in and not knowing anything about Korean food, I was surprised to find it was a Korean spot. But the food was great! I had their BBQ beef rice bowl and they threw in some chicken tempura for me to try. Since I had to wait all of 5 minutes for the beef to finish, they also gave me a tea while I waited. Excellent customer service! Both the man at the counter and woman at the register was so gracious and courteous. If I'm ever in town, I'll be sure to pay a visit. It was a welcoming environment for someone who was just passing through.

0fxCbEy7ZElf3Qx3qHpwyg.text: The food here is amazing and the owners Ed and Ashely are sweethearts! Its hard to find a fast, ingredient-conscience restaurant and I am so happy I did! Highly recommend and you can create your own dish! What's not to like!

k6udZtItObuRr7PqUeXZMA.text: What a treat! After coming back from NYC, I was searching for Korean BBQ. I found Bae Bae's through UberEats and OMG it did not disappoint. From the appetizers to the KFC and Spicy Chicken, everything we have had here is tremendous! Huge portions, fresh and fun offerings. Bae Bae's is an awesome addition to PGH.

W-WpDHeLBllSiV1ViboK4Q.text: Los Angeles' Koreatown is my favorite food destination at home, but my daughter found Bae Bae's on a visit to Pittsburgh. My daughter had the bulgogi and a taro milk tea with boba. I had tofu, sauce on the side, glass noodle and a bean sprout spicy banchan. All orders come with salad and extra salad can be ordered instead of rice or noodle. The person who attended to us was super nice and very accommodating to food allergies and preferences. Once you get over it not being a traditional Korean restaurant, it's a great find. The portion was enough for two meals for me. I prefer tofu that is not fried and prefer less sweet sauces, but I had the plum sauce on the side and used a little Sriracha. The glass noodles were springy and fresh. The taro milk tea was sooo good too.

JWN2UVn_oLXmo0FYyfrlDQ.text: I am not in town very often during the lunch hour but when I am I tend to stick to what I know is close and fast. We all know the lines can get long around noon downtown.   I had some extra time this week and decided to give Bae Bae's a try.  It was only a little after noon and I was surprised how fast I got my food.  It was great!  I opted to try the beef bulgogi and OMG.  Yes.  Sign me up for that for lunch every day.  It was delicious!   With it I have noodles and vegetable tempura.  The noodle were also great and went elk with the beef. The vegetables were a great crunch to go with the dish.  I honestly have no idea what type of vegetables they were but they were good.    I got my lunch Togo and it was nice and fast.  If you choose to eat there I would just make note that there are only a hand full of tables so I am sure there r times they are full.  It was a nice day so I chose to head to strawberry way and sit at one of the tables out as it was a gorgeous day out.  Will definitely return in the future!

U6ddq7n339SapuWheL1XbA.text: Bae Bae's is fantastic. I have been going there semi-regularly since opening. The ownership behind the establishment are lovely people.  I always get the japchae with tofu, salad, and plum sauce. Not once have I been disappointed.  The only thing one should be aware of is long lines if you don't get in early.

xNTSdJfUHvem1xmR01XDNg.text: I have been a friend of this place since day 1.   I say friend, because their customer service and friendliness goes above and beyond making you feel like you are more than a customer.   From lunch during the week to dinner with the family on the weekends, the food is always amazing.   It comes out quick like fast food but always being made fresh, with fresh ingredients.  I wouldn't say I have a favorite because I often jump between everything and find it hard to decide.  The KFC, bulgogi, and chicken stir fry are VERY good, and love how they bring in other random dishes as well and find myself trying those or sometimes regrettably missing out on the specialty dishes after seeing them on social media, lol.  I took my mother in-law who lives a few hours away to Bae Baes last year.  She was born / raised in Korea and is usually unimpressed by some attempts at Korean food..... She liked the food a lot and often talks about the place when we visit her.  Her co-sign says a lot in my book :)   Anyway stop in, try one of their iced or hot drinks,   the desserts and build your meal selecting the options you want.  Sit outside in the outdoor garden when its nice or the nicely decorated inside.  They pack it up nice for to go as well.    Tell them Jay sent you!

cHNfFJTvzPiBkHSY4wSY4Q.text: All parents will understand that this is hands-down the best recommendation I could give: My daughter requested Bae Bae's for her 10th birthday dinner. We always order the fried chicken, glass noodles, and Kimchi (spicy but amazing!). We've never been disappointed by the day's specials.

xR4CIkc6Xo9Sdz3LczltOw.text: Food: Good - The fried noodles and Korean chicken is flavorful and the meat is juicy. The fried egg plant is also amazing. I wish everything wasn't so greasy. If the grease stays on your lips, it's never a good sign.  Service: Great - You can be in and out of there in about 5-10minutes, even with a line. Staff is always friendly and willing to explain things to new explorers.  Overall: Recommend - If you're downtown or craving Korean, it's a great spot to grab a bite. It's nothing like what you would get in a bigger city like NYC, but it does the trick.

WKbRF7lllxrQw_m4XsryWw.text: As a vegetarian, I loved this place. So many yummy veggie options to choose from, and you get a lot of food for just $10 - two meals worth.   I got the golden pockets (tofu) with glass noodles and veggie tempura. I also got the cheese wontons to split with a friend, and they were delicious. Would definitely come again!

SlzpAIwuCLryWO7J7IxteQ.text: I'm in town for a conference and needed some legit non-hotel food. This was the perfect lunch. I wish this was in my neighborhood at home because I would eat here all the time!

sBhybR0PZhYMxc05g_9kkg.text: Stopped by on a lovely afternoon for a late lunch with a friend. I'd been meaning to try this place out and finally got the chance! Loved the decor (they have plants hanging everywhere!!) and found it super casual and fresh. Now the food...delish!  I'm so happy to have finally found a place Downtown with awesome Korean food, on par with the Korean food I've had in NYC. The wait was a little bit, but they were definitely preparing the food fresh which was so worth it.  I started with the noodles and had the Korean fried chicken with the soybean sprouts as a side. The noodles were nice and chewy with yummy veggies, not too oily or salty. The chicken was AMAZEBALLS, surprisingly super moist with a great crispy crust. The sides were also great and the wasabi honey dipping sauce for the chicken was great as well. Can't wait to come back!

b2INQWoz3pHTlJDA3zsNAg.text: This place was totally alright. I was at the convention center and stopped in for lunch. The line was a little long and the price a little high but the food was certainly of quality. It was worth trying for sure, but i wasn't blown away by top notch interesting cuisine.  I had the KBBQ and got a resonably large portion of food in a fast casual setting without any fuss. I guess what i'm really trying to convey with this is that I had no issues or exciting moments when eating this food. Generally 3 star reviews are the hardest to write because this place was generic to the point of it being mostly non memorable, which, is both a good and a bad thing. You should try it, but if you don't go back that's essentially what I was thinking would happen.

d1x0__3DQOLkciigKPM7gA.text: I have no earthly idea why I haven't reviewed my favorite mid-level restaurant in Pittsburgh yet. It's stupid. Stupid! Why do we always ignore the ones we love the most?  Bae Bae's has been feeding me at least three to four times a week now since I started a new job about six months ago. It's practically my home away from home now. I thought I might starve or go broke trying to eat downtown. So much gross. So little good.  But I love the ritual of getting out of the office and sitting down in a decent locale and just eating. Packing lunch gets so sad.   So why Bae Bae's? Because their food makes you feel good. I never feel sick after eating there. Or regretful. Or disgusted with myself. That's worth $20 right there.  And oh my heavenly stars is their Bulgogi good! I've tried almost everything there and it's my favorite by far. You can't really go wrong with whatever you order but just shut-up and order the bulgogi. Trust me on that. And get it with the rice so it can soak up the lovely juices. Next you should get the veggie tempura. The sweet potato is my favorite. Broccoli is fab too if they have it. You can get other sides like kimchi but the veggie tempura is a perfect accompaniment to the bulgogi. And whatever you do, don't leave without the Vietnamese coffee. It's the best I've ever had. Their Thai iced tea is great too but oh man is that coffee the best. I get quite cranky when they run out. If they have the bulgogi wontons, just shut-up and order those too. But "I already have bulgogi on my plate," you say? Seriously? Why are you denying yourself even more bulgogi? Shut-up.  Pro Tip: If you're a frugal eater, you can easily make two meals out of one to go order - everything warms up perfectly.   Other things to note: this place is very much like a little oasis in gritty, rude Pittsburgh. I always hate to step back out onto the street. And while the weather holds, they have a pop-up outdoor area right on Liberty Street.   Run! Don't walk! And stop complaining they're too pricey ya meatheads. This is not some $8 GorgeFest. Their food is organic, fresh and homemade -  so it costs more. Duh.  Actually I'm already regretting writing this review. I don't want any more people in line in front of me. But Bae Bae's must be shared.

jUOzwAdkXCtXE2RFR-QnDw.text: Bae Bae's Kitchen serves up Korean-fusion food in a fast-casual environment. While having a limited menu, the execution on everything is near flawless.   I ordered the Korean Fried Chicken with Glass Noodles and a side Spicy Crab Salad, and every order comes with a side salad in a spicy vinaigrette dressing. The attention given to the quality of ingredients and presentation is phenomenal, especially for a fast casual location. The Korean Fried Chicken comes with 2 chicken breasts, and is coated in panko and lightly fried till golden brown, yet remains far from oily (a huge plus!). The KFC also came with a cup of Honey Wasabi dipping sauce that was very unique and incredibly tasty. The sweetness of the honey comes through and finishes with the tingling and small kick of Wasabi. Even if you're not a fan of Wasabi, I highly recommend giving this sauce a try - it tasted exceptional on everything!The Glass Noodles I think were my favorite option at Bae Bae's - they're incredibly tender and the large chunks of onions and scallions sauteed in sesame oil is just as good as it sounds. The Spicy Crab salad was actually spicy and went great with the KFC. They have a ton of other offerings as a "side option" such as Cucumber Kim chi, vegetable tempura, etc.   They also offer a daily special - I think the day I visited they were serving Pork and Rice, but I think you have less customizability with the daily specials as I couldn't swap out the Rice for Glass Noodles. I can't wait to go back soon and see what other daily specials they offer.   This was my first time to Bae Bae's Kitchen, but it will definitely not be my last visit.

They give you a lot of food, but they don't make great leftovers so I wish the servings were a smaller, and in turn, a little cheaper. I think that would really beneficial for them! Less food waste too then!

klDoBQ9Fg0NlzZM5zjiJmQ.text: Loved the concept, a Korean style fast food place. You can get either rice or noodles, a side salad, a choice of protein, and one banchan.   The portion was perfect for me, tons of veggies with delicious chicken cutlets. The food was delicious,and the service was very friendly.

T_BPXto_PZ6RuJ3t1biZcA.text: This is an amazing place, friendly staff and excellent food A must stop for people with dietary requirements eg avoiding gluten and vegan. Highly recommended is the tofu and the kimchi. Great value too.

v_hKhjeKK6K9EONOxzLYqA.text: I just had to try this new place in town! It's hard to find good Korean food and I was thrilled to find this place downtown. We came here during early dinner on a weekday and it was pretty empty. I wasn't too thrilled that the food was kind of buffet style where it was already made and you saw them put it on the box, this just doesn't seem as fresh as if they were to make it in the back as you don't know how long that food has been sitting there.   We got the pork belly with the glass noodles and fried squash to go. By the time we got home, the food was pretty cold but it didn't bother me. The food was okay. The pork belly wasn't seasoned that well as I couldn't taste anything and the noodles weren't even close to the best ones I had. My favorite part was the fried squash which surprisingly was good. Overall, I didn't really care for the food as I thought that it was overpriced for the quantity.

dQ-v9Md6r3Eq8pDsTQFtfA.text: A friend and I came in for a quick lunch and we both ordered the noodles with tofu. I got the cucumber kimchee as my included side item and my friend got the vegetable tempura. We also split an order of the cheese wontons. Everything was delicious, especially the cheese wontons and the cucumber kimchee. The cucumber kimchee was a little bit sweeter than traditional kimchee, which I liked. They have a very well-decorated back sitting area and provide wooden disposable forks and chopsticks.   My only complaint is the prices. The cheese wontons were $4, but we only got 3 small ones. The meal was $12 with tofu, which is slightly higher than other places I would consider comparable to this one. However, we did get a lot of food in the main dish. Overall, I would come back to Bae Baes kitchen if I am in downtown Pittsburgh and I would recommend it to my friends.

npJP4EvimKBswebmUSXNhQ.text: What's not to love about Bae Baes? The first time visiting here the staff was super nice and friendly. I came at an off hour around 8 pm so it was relatively empty inside. The space is beautiful and filled with greenery. It's also larger than expected with a front room and a back room. When we ordered, the staff took extra time to explain to us the menu and walk us through the ordering process. I got the KFC (Korean fried chicken) with a side salad and kimchi. The chicken was delicious and the salad was a pretty large portion. My only complaint is the small prepackaged portion size of the kimchi, it's so good I could have eaten 4 of them! Also; they don't accept tips, they use tip money instead to donate to charity which I love. Overall, if you're looking for a cute "cafe vibe" with amazing food, bae baes is the place for you!

k32c5u_Z_QcC2LmTcyDtlg.text: The bulgogi is so freaking good. The beef is tender and juicy, it's grass fed and the flavors really come through. The kimchi is so super good too.  I like to share meals but the portions here are enough for one person at lunchtime. With that said, I have shared a lunch entree here before. This downtown restaurant is small but seating is available if you get there at the right now. Prices are affordable and makes for a great place to have lunch.

ukboa_WhwE7U429yLANPAw.text: Hands down my favorite new spot to eat when I visit Pittsburg! The aesthetic of their restaurant is so comfortable and inviting, with lots of plants and a soft, modern style. I got their crispy tofu with plum sauce and purple rice and it was perfectly cooked and the sauce especially was to die for. The simplicity of the menu made for easy ordering, which I was a fan of. Employees were very sweet and helpful and the wait time for my food was reasonable for how busy it was. If you're visiting Pittsburg or a local, you've got to try this place!

This restaurant took some initiative to be green with having wooden utensils and paper straws. I don't mind paying a little more to enjoy a nice, hearty meal for $15. Would recommended 10/10.

jT9tzx017Eb5JrwtByo7eQ.text: Stopped by here yesterday before the KH Concert at Heinz Hall. I've heard about this place from many people so I finally decided to try it out!  I had the spicy chicken with rice and veggie tempura and my boyfriend had the bulgogi with rice and kimchi. I was actually pretty surprised by the kimchi because as someone who only ever eats her mom's kimchi, it was pretty good. This place is on the pricier side but they give you a lot of food and you can tell that it's fresh. It's hot and tasty, and the variety of options is actually pretty intriguing.   The service was really nice and they were really attentive. Food came out pretty quickly. Atmosphere is really welcoming and relaxed. I love all the natural lighting and plants! I would definitely consider coming here again the next time I'm downtown.

Q7Fevpwiagl-nmYUET7dfQ.text: What a beautiful spot first of all! Super busy at lunchtime so get there early- although they definitely moved at an efficient pace! I ordered the tofu platter and it did not disappoint. I don't like spicy things and was able to enjoy everything I ordered. Highly recommend the seaweed salad. I went with noodles but would probably opt for rice next time. Tofu was perfectly cooked and seasoned. Of course I topped everything off with a boba milk tea- always a fav! I'll be back soon and will be recommending to friends!

r6t987aZVu2jqE8IYt3pQA.text: I tried Bae Bae's for dinner with my friend. It's a cute place, like the whole place could go on Instagram! They have succulents and terrariums decorating the concrete floored restaurant, giving the place a modern, dreamy vibe. It was my friend's first exposure to Korean food and I have only tried Korean food once or twice prior myself. The staff was helpful in explaining the menu and making recommendations.   Basically, you choose a protein (bulgogi beef, Korean fried chicken, spicy fried chicken, or fried tofu); a side of rice, salad, or glass noodles; and a small side like kimchi or fried vegetables (or some other options exist as well). Each order is also prepared with a small side salad.   My friend ordered Korean fried chicken, the glass noodles, and fried vegetables. I ordered the bulgogi beef, rice, and kimchi. My friend said the food was delicious and I definitely agreed! She said the fried chicken was some of the best she ever had, and I thought the beef was a real treat too! Normally I don't eat much red meat, but I definitely enjoyed this preparation with the unique sweet and savory flavor. Also, I have to point out that the bulgogi was the only non-fried option for protein, and the glass noodles are also fried, so if you have a stomach sensitive to fried foods your options become a little limited. I would recommend Bae Bae's adds another protein option that is not fried.   All of the foods a very nicely prepared and the presentation is lovely. My rice even came molded into a heart shape as decorated with black sesame seeds! The portions are moderately sized, and for the cost of the meal you are partially paying for presentation, location, and atmosphere so I do think it is worth it. Especially worth it if you are new to Korean food - if so, you will leave liking some new foods! Otherwise you'll just leave happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bulgogi and rice dish - yum!

l9u5nDx_2xwvztPze1NMmg.text: Loved Bae Bae's Kitchen! Visited for the first time during Jazz Fest. The service was great - everyone was friendly and helpful.   They offer build-you-own bowl style food which includes a base, a protein, a salad and a side. I tried the noodles, chicken bulgogi and kimchi. The food comes in a to-go box... which you will definitely need because the portion size is huge!!! The food was delicious. The chicken bulgogi had a nice flavor and the noodles were good even though they were a bit greasy. I was glad that a salad was included because it helped to freshen it up! We also tried some of the bigger side options that did not come with the meal including a fried cheese soze  I really enjoyed the space. I sat along the front window surrounded by plants and was able to people watch! I would definitely return and try some other options.
