AKT6QRQ_qEzhG984PuBi6A.text: I would eat at Bae Bae's everyday if I could. Its close to my work and I have eaten here many times. The food is addictive. Love the kfc, the wasabi dipping sauce that it comes with is so good. Love the bulgogi, cooked to perfection. Love love love the vietnamese iced coffee. I get it with boba for an extra treat. Its so freaking good. The person who takes the orders is always very friendly and so positive and kind, even with how busy they always are. The rad people in the kitchen and working on the line are magicians and so nice as well. Love this place.

TQnHwireZukupk5KleQnTQ.text: I hate to be one of the first to give this place a rating that isn't fantastic but I have to be honest about my recent experience. After my coworker and fellow yelper told me about a new place opening by work I was thrilled to check it out. After seeing the great yelp reviews and having someone stop me on the street to tell me how good it was, I thought for sure it had to be amazing. Sadly I was left very disappointing.  The place itself is definitely very small so this isn't a place for big parties. Food is served in to go boxes so I think the general idea is that most will take their food back to the office with them. The decor and atmosphere of the restaurant is very cute. What fell really short for me was the food and service. The staff was extremely slow serving and ringing out customers. Of course this place is new so that's expected as they work out some of the kinks but being part of the downtown lunch scene means you really need to get that part right so people can quickly return to work.   After much debating I ended up going with the KFC (fried chicken) with glass noodles. The chicken was cooked absolutely perfectly I will say but what really disappointed me most was the daily sauce they gave you with the chicken. It has a very strange taste almost like it had alcohol in it. It wasn't even edible in my opinion. The noodles were probably the best part of my lunch. One of the other things that sadly left me a little disappointed was the fact that they were just out of particular side dishes. I was extremely excited to try the cucumber kimchi and they didn't have any for that day.   With all of that being said I would probably give it another try and possibly go with the beef next time. I would still recommend everyone check it out because others seem to really like it and everyone has different opinions.

LfaHRAz0Lnjuwp5TGV8JFA.text: If you are facing down a difficult/long day at work I highly recommend you eat here.   Their meals contain all the food groups---some lightly dressed greens, a carb, a protein, a side, and a little treat (the sweet potato tempura). Basically you get a full stomach but don't feel yuck afterwards...you feel energized and happy! I'm not really a woo-woo type but I think because the food is sourced well and made with care that contributes to the positive vibes.  They also give you enough food for another small meal later in the day so I feel the price is worth it. The owners and the people who work here are lovely and incredibly hospitable.

NONZp4BIYdCIlb4OHef2LQ.text: Very interesting! I went here for lunch because of a coworker recommendation. You get a lot of food for the price. I got the tofu with rice noodles and crab salad. They could probably only give 2 blocks of tofu and lower the price a tad. A little tofu goes a long way. I'll definitely be back though!

Qbt7kGwFl91i_pJHpuXlJA.text: I come for lunch about twice a month. Line can get to be out the door and doesn't move super fast. They changed up the line and how/where you order, it's very confusing. You order to the left now and the food is the right. There is always a cluster of people waiting for their food to go. If you remember bring your own takeout bag! The food is good, but not out of the park for the price. Expect a $20 lunch. Everyone that works there is nice, which is refreshing being downtown. The Viet Coffee is my hands down favorite and the tempura sweet potatoes never disappoint. Eat there is you can, the food is so much better warm. The Korean Fried Chicken (KFC) is always delicious, but if you don't like wasabi (I think) then you have no sauce to eat it with. I've tried the pork belly and short ribs, both were good, still not sure they're worth $14-17 dollar with rice or kimchi as a side. Also they do not take tips, those go to the animal shelter, so I can't help but to donate every time I stop in!

3YRYGLOYjjKuoyb3pwPOTg.text: Comfortable atmosphere playing American pop music. Spent $40. Summary is a fast food version of Korean food where they cut costs by using cheap ingredients and attempt to supplement for real ingredients while cheating the consumer with overpriced food. This seems to be the trend in Pittsburgh. We had the noodles with bulgogi and seaweed salad, the rice with (Korean Fried Chicken) KFC, sweet potato tempura, miso soup and a chamomile tea. Chamomile tea was $3.  Miso was comparable to the miso you can purchase at Walmart but bae bae's is $3. I personally think the out of the whole meal the sweet potato tempura was the best because of the creamy spicy wasabi sauce. Their KFC was chicken tenders with  Japanese breadcrumbs on it and tastes like the oil it was fried in with no seasoning. There was some honey wasabi sauce they added on the side but it did little to make up for the lack of effort placed in making the food. The seaweed salad was imitation made of cucumber (!) and was basically an attempt to take a short cut to make a base for their daily side the Crab Salad. The beef bulgogi had enough fat and tendon on it you might choke trying to swallow it (why did I pay for fat and tendon?) they also have half cups of iced tea. If you order one they fill it with ice and you may be fooled into believing you got what you payed for. Don't settle for the Americanized dumbdown version get the real thing at the Korean Garden in Shadyside or the Korean restaurant in Oakland.

lqNejY65D-7LPwLRA0TL8w.text: Great restaurant. Casual atmosphere with many potted plants that have a calming effect. I had the garlic noodles which had oodles of garlic in them. My food took a while to arrive so one the employees gave me a free appetizer. I would definitely eat here again.

5wEnele1WYiDeZGQay2Olg.text: On a trip, wish we had something like this back home. Great food and healthy too! Two thumbs up!

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

MgH8NifTMymNpvy449574w.text: Food was great. I had the pork belly and noodles with kimchi. Kimchi was homemade and spicy, it was excellent. They also gave us some free sides which was very nice.

Z8TM1Sy3C5G7-ukLLlGdlQ.text: Such a cute place! Stellar customer service and well decorated. Lots of plants and a nice vibe. I got the tofu salad + kimchi side + squash tempura. The tofu was some of the best I've ever had. We went yesterday for lunch for the first time and we're going back today, which tells you all you need to know about how much I loved it.

Arfe9lpBthFiVV9kagnDYA.text: I was craving Korean food, and after all the positive reviews I had read about this place, I decided to give it a go after work. I got the beef, which was marinated in what I thought was too sweet a stew, with the glass noodles, seaweed salad, and they threw in a complementary salad and tempura sweet potato (yum!). It is a popular spot and sometimes they will sell out of some of their dishes (the pork was sold out, and people were waiting for the chicken to be finished in the kitchen).  However, in terms of satiating my Korean craving, it didn't quite hit the spot. The flavors were okay, but not great. I think next time I have such a craving, I'll go elsewhere.

Eo3ri2SP5ix9K2kbpHKbuQ.text: Sooooo good!! Coming from a Korean-- her food is great!! Fresh, delicious and a great concept downtown! Nothing like it! Absolute must try! And the interior decor  green plants, clean and welcoming! Just love this new spot in Pittsburgh!

bG3xx7kmAd3Qhapk1jQHKA.text: I am in love with this place from the aesthetics to the food. I popped in for the first time yesterday. For a place that just opened last week, I was impressed by the efficiency. The menu is straightforward Korean food with no fancy tricks, just delicious cooking!  I ordered bulgogi over fried rice with a side of kimchi - it was delicious. As a bonus, they tossed in a sample of potato tempura, and that too was tasty. While I ordered my food to-go, I did notice how cozy the eatery was for dining in. I look forward to frequenting this spot and working my way through the menu. Good food, fast and friendly service. Bae Bae's kitchen is such a gem.

SNI1Reo4lpNP2ZtD9CWvLw.text: I had the noodles and bulgogi bowl with seaweed salad on the side for about $14. A bit pricey but the food tasted awesome, especially by Pittsburgh Asian food standard. I just wish the serving size could be a little bigger especially for the seaweed salad. However they were pretty generous with the portion of bolgogi so I won't complain. It would also be nicer if the noodles were less greasy.

qxpoAEp3iK7xzXcIlmD-yw.text: It's a Korean restaurant (more like a cafe) that serves lunch box type food. Portion is generous, and lunch boxes are pretty. But as a Korean, I feel like the food here is too westernized.

2k_Du6ZsR3rdZniITxUpAQ.text: Delicious lunch! I had the noodles and Korean Beef and the Vietnamese coffee Boba tea. I didn't. Love the coffee, but the food was great. Very flavorful, and pretty large. A little pricey, but good to treat yourself every once in a while!

Q48DfOjVWjthOUFzKO3eKw.text: Stopped here for a quick bite before a workshop at Arcade. Had the bulgogi with rice and a side of kimchi. It came with sweet potato tempura and a few greens too. The food was DELICIOUS! So good! And the staff was incredibly friendly, helpful, and kind. The space seats 12 at tables and 9 or 10 at the bar-like seating. I had no problem getting a spot when I stopped in. Highly recommend!!!

GD23lLwUMM6ZO8Z6gSChYQ.text: I was staying at the drury inn across the street and was looking for something that was no bar food or heavy. Thought I'd give it a try. Very tasty, very fresh and very clean. I travel a lot and it is always nice to find something a little different, within budget, and walking distance from where one stays. Good choice unless u like bland food.

r2DOpu6iiUkjyDDlTFoa7g.text: Place is amazing!! What a great ass to the area finally my craving for some good korean food has been met !

A36JZyMDvNkF25p-HXy5oQ.text: The tofu skin I had today for lunch was excellent, and everyone I was with was please with the chicken and bulgogi! So so tasty! And a ery nicely decorated spot to have lunch. The back room is quieter and calmer. I totally love Bae Bae's!

XkXRsOkkMGvN-RXl75sTUA.text: Was craving Korean food while driving through PA and found this little gem. Taste like my mom's cooking,  but cleaner and more fresh. 2 thumbs up for Bae Bae! Please open Bae Bae's #2 in Pal Park NJ!

oOiTdbBDMPBINEWVP4MOIw.text: Had a really wonderful lunch here.  Staff was friendly and the food was excellent.  I wish I had taken a photo because it looked great too.

D2mGTZLrvL5gsYXeLYAJVA.text: I've been searching for a place to execute Tofu the way it should be executed.  Finding this place was a saving grace from the usual lunch spots while working downtown.  The employees were very friendly in explaining what each dish was so you'd make the best decision.  I can't speak highly enough about the Tofu, crisp on the outside and tender on the inside, every place I've had Tofu at anywhere in Pittsburgh has been mush; this place did it right! The flavors are all on point, seaweed salad is well balanced and I would put the plum sauce for the Tofu on EVERYTHING if I could. The only complaint I have is how pricey the menu is and everything does seem to be fried.  I wish there were more non-fried options, but that will not deter me from coming here at least twice a month.

AwF0LAu106VIqAei86aNSg.text: Super cute!!! The food is great! The theme is cute! There is even a little hidden Totoro figure in the front plants! Its a Pittsburgh must!!!

67mGL37WZyI9M4Dbp-qJJw.text: came here on a hot summer day and everything was just "okay" EXCEPT the tofu which was honestly terrible. sooooo insanely greasy & oily, and made me feel like i was sweating out grease for the rest of the day. almost like i was just eating fried batter with barely any actual tofu inside. the pickles were also swimming in oil :/ felt really sluggish and sleepy all day afterwards, definitely not what I was expecting based on reviews saying it was super healthy & light! also HIGHLY recommend not coming at peak hours unless you have a lot of time to kill. I probably spent over an hour in here, but only a few minutes of that was actually taken up by me eating, haha. gave 2 stars instead of 1 because the atmosphere is really beautiful, and I *would* be willing to give this another try if i was downtown just based on how many positive reviews this place has! hopefully i just came on an off day.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. vegan plate: tofu, salad, pickles, noodles

-kCuuchksDAAyJe__xmELw.text: This is my first Korean food outing and I went to NO OTHER than Bae Bae's little 'ole kitchen...  This is a cute, small, modern cafe with seating in the front and a MAGICAL dining room in the back with lots of lights.  I tried the choose your own combo with salad and glass noodles that had an Asian sesame sauce, some fried zucchini and fried Korean chicken with wasabi honey sauce that was tender and moist.  They also have a hot bar where you pick your own food.  It was good if you like Korean styled food or vegan food or fried treats and snacks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salad, glass noodles, chicken with honey wasabi sauce and fried zucchini
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Front dining room
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Magical back room dining room

9K-jGr1vEDSwUYKvjJ2FhQ.text: Cute new lunch spot downtown. It brings a unique flair to the typical restaurants you'll see around here. They offer essentially a build-your-own rice/noodle bowl. For vegetarians, they have a fried tofu option, but I was not overly impressed with the bland and unseasoned taste. It was fairly average quality food and portions were not enough to keep me full.   For a fast casual style restaurant, they still need to work on the fast part. The long lines are caused by the slow pace of getting people served. Since they're so new, they're probably working out the kinks. Another downfall is that they run out of food too quickly. I was there less than 2 hours after they opened and they were already out of half of their menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Veggie &amp; Tofu Kim Bap
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Tofu

l7tAE41H0nP4OjWJHIHS2g.text: Wonderful service! Very tasty side salad dressing and purple rice. The seaweed (wakame) salad was on point! Tried the fried chicken and vegetable tempura. Items were plentiful and not "oily" but unfortunately these were pretty dry. Tempura was not the usual lightly battered, flavorful veggies but seasoned panko crusted crunchy crumble.

WofyhPpjxyYpG3eF-9ilBw.text: #BaeBae'sKitchen is one of the best restaurants in Pittsburgh! I tried them for first time last week (where have I been?). Had the spicy chicken stir fry, glass noodles and delicious cucumber kimchee (can I get a bug jar of it, seriously?). The meal comes with a little salad--bonus! Was enough for lunch and dinner. The flavors were all phenomenal and I can't wait to try something else.  Big shout out to the owners for their eco-friendly business model! From the cardboard containers to the wooden utensils to the paper bags--love it all!   And another shout out to the staff. Every person I talked to was personable and patient with this newby. Since I had several minutes to wait,  I had chance to ask several questions,  all of which were answered enthusiastically! Kudos! See you soon  :)

5uIriS1ImkcObygIQ_6uAQ.text: I had the Korean Fried Chicken, with noodles and the vegetables as my sides.  The boneless chicken breast (2 large planks) was fried crispy and tender. The noodles were lightly dressed, along with the salad greens. The veggies, also breaded and fried, were crisp, and not at all greasy.  If I have one complaint, it is too much food.  I would like the option of smaller portions, instead of doggie bagging the leftover food home, especially since I do not have a refrigerator on my bike.

lViheBJQZH9zWPuNb3ZMfw.text: I don't give five star reviews easily or frequently.  However, Bae Bae deserves it.  We stumbled upon this lovely gem when a few of us were looking for lunch after going to the Andy Warhol museum.  We had a wedding later that day and wanted something yummy but not too heavy.  First off, the owner is awesome!  So patiently answered all of our questions and didn't mind that we broke our order up into smaller orders so each person could pay for their own.  While waiting for our food (which came out pretty quickly), we were brought complimentary tempura.  Soooo good!  Lightly battered and fried.  I had the buns filled with chicken - although fried, the chicken was tender and still light.  The kimchi was perfectly spicy - not too over the top.  I also really enjoyed the potato salad side.  One friend had the pork belly buns and greatly enjoyed them.  The other had the boodles with pork belly and also enjoyed those.  If I find myself back in the Pittsburgh area, I will definitely pop back in for some more yummies.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

j3MhmYAfkqEexY8qtKmmFA.text: A friend and I decided to meet for lunch and we wanted to go somewhere we have never been.  After a quick search on Yelp, we choose Bae Bae's Kitchen.  The place itself is very small/quaint.  I can see how it would be difficult to get a place to sit during peak times.  Since we visited after the lunch rush, there were several seats open.  We chose to sit at the table that faces the sidewalk and got to wave at several people peeking in the window.  All of the staff that we encountered were very friendly and helpful.  I ended up ordering a bubble milk tea, Korean Fried Chicken (so much for healthy!)with glass noddles & spicy crab salad.  We also ordered the crab wontons.  I really enjoyed the milk tea, noodles and spicy crab salad.  The crab wontons were excellent.  I really enjoyed the sauce that came with the wontons.  The chicken was cooked very well and was crispy and fresh, I just didn't really care for the sauce that came with it.    The meal was $12 by itself and I felt that a reasonable portion was provided.  My total bill was $21 when the milk tea and wontons were added.  I can't spend that on a lunch everyday, but it was a nice treat.  I will be back and will try some different proteins.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Close up of spicy crab salad.
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean Fried Chicken (KFC), glass noodles, spicy crab salad, greens and bubble milk tea
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. I like that you could have a visual of the food before you order.  It helped an indecisive person like me.

Fh7GYzwdPCT9I_B95ksU_A.text: So we stop by last weekend during the Pride Festival. The storefront was closed, but they had a stand. The options were more limited than the menu, but we still tried. An order of glass noodles, wings, and Thai ice tea with boba. Noodles were great, wonderful flavor. Wings were basic and it was the spicy mayo that added the flavor. Not the Korean wings I'm accustomed to. Thai ice tea with boba was on point. All in all, it was pricey and above average. So why the five stars?   Well, go to the storefront! I found myself in the area the following Tuesday and the aroma won me over. I got the pork with rice special. At $10, it was much more reasonable than the festival pricing. The pork was so hearty and included a boiled egg, very much traditional Asian. It was quite sizable and I found myself with leftovers. Overall, the flavor was wonderful and vibe was fast paced but polite. Definitely come by!

q9viyEkpvgQ8GDoidrmNsw.text: Delicious Thai tea with boba and friendly staff! It's $5 so definitely on the pricey side but good nonetheless. The cafe is very cute, very well decorated, and provides a nice place to study or have intimate conversations as it is semi-quiet.

gFvjRzyimdI1-mM0VWyLuQ.text: Super cute interior and very friendly staff. My boyfriend and I visited during our one night stay in Pittsburgh and I'm glad this was our choice. My boyfriend got the bulgolgi with purple rice and I got the Korean fried chicken with purple rice. We both got cucumbers as our side. My boyfriend also got the Thai tea with boba. All the food was very good and very filling. I'd definitely recommend this place and will probably stop by again if I'm ever in Pittsburgh.

q1wCgo_PSSd0cirg4l84gQ.text: A very cool little place to get lunch when you are downtown. The line seems intimidating at first, but it goes very quickly and the food is also pretty quick. The menu is nice because you arent overwhelmed with options to choose from, mostly just the basics. The glass noodles are fantastic, but the real winner for me was the tempura fried vegetables. They were fantastic, I wish I had gotten more of them. Definitely check it out!

Jy0RuLT3atc0sJ-J-Eyggw.text: Pleasantly surprised with the food. I got the spicy stir fried chicken and rice with seaweed salad. The food was very good and good portion sizes. The place is cute inside but small. The staff was bery nice and friendly. I will definitely be back.

Ve8D75MBNqX6a4O_oPlPgg.text: The girls at my hair salon all rave about Bae Bae's! So today I was off of work and since I had some appointments at the salon, I thought it would be a great excuse to try it out! I love the vibe in there! It's so cute! Everyone that works there is so nice and helpful! Being that it was my first time, I wasn't sure how to properly order (it's build your own) but the girl at the counter helped me with my selections. The guy behind the counter also seemed like a total sweetie!  I ordered the bulgogi, rice and kimchi cucumbers. It also came with some dressed mixed greens which made me happy because i wasn't sure i had ordered enough veggies! The bulgogi was good with sweet onions and scallions! It was a little bit greasy for me but I also think that is partially my fault for my selection knowing that I am not a big fan of greasy spoon meals. The cucumbers were awesome! And the greens were lightly dressed and refreshing!  I am definitely going to come back to Bae Bae's. I failed to mention there is a coffee bar and i got a really good iced latte! I may switch my order up but i was pleased overall!

VFZSZI_cugqJS-8kiShzTQ.text: Every trip is great. Their environment, staff, and food are all top notch.

ZCJtmFNlnmwEJUMOY3CNVw.text: This place is legit!  Am here on business and saw this cute restaurant and decided to stop in and give it a try.  I'm sure glad I did!  Liked having the option of building my own box.  I chose the bulgogi with glass noodles, and kimchi cucumbers.  The food was very fresh and the service was excellent.  It is a tad bit pricey, but I'm willing to pay more for quality ingredients.  Will be back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bulgogi, glass noodles, salad &amp; kimchi cucumbers
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

0p8f3uCTGvNwL1De7zzZBA.text: Such an awesome spot! The atmosphere is really cool and earthy, and the music is very relaxing. As far as the food goes the cheese wonton is the best I've had, and that fire sauce is bomb.com. One of my favorite spots in Pittsburgh for sure, always make a stop here if you're in the city!

5UbABBeyTQsyIkd2k89fMA.text: After reading all the stellar reviews, I was psyched to eat delicious Korean food. I now live in a small Midwestern city with no Korean options, so a 4+ star reviewed fast casual place with bulgogi a half block from my hotel after a long morning of flights seemed perfect. (Oh, how I miss eating in Minneapolis...) Staff were very nice, and the decor is beautiful. The music was a tad loud for my taste, but I'm pretty sound sensitive. The food, however, was so disappointing: the noodles and bulgogi were okay but bland and rather oily. I could taste what could have been an awesome meal, but the flavor was very weak. I don't think I would have been as bummed out if I hadn't had such high expectations, so be prepared for it to be less than the hype.

5Je-bCHwNj2xdOMdRvQ2xA.text: Got bulgogi with glass noodles. Not the best bulgogi I've had it was a bit dry and not as flavorful. The glass noodles I think was the best out of the dish. Did not try the fried chicken I think they were out since it was almost closing time

cgdMettyvM-a1jjc_ut4pw.text: Great food and good quantity. Both are marks of a good restaurant.  The tofu was super crispy and something new and perfectly done. Wish we had the time to eat it again. It went very well with the glass noodles.  Will look it up if we happen to be in Pittsburgh again.

Doz2bUzg_MhXzNqt93ighw.text: I'm not going to lie, I wasn't expecting anything that good going in. You go in and sort of make your own bowl in a way. When I went it was bulgogi or the Korean fried chicken. My friend and I had one of each and I got tempura vegetables as my side along with rice. One thing is I did feel my rice was over cooked, it was all just really mushy. However, everything tastes really great. My chicken was fried super fresh and juicy, and his bulgogi has great flavors. I wish the chicken had more sauce options to add to it but I still enjoyed it. I only ate half and was able to save half for lunch the next day so while it was definitely pricey for lunch, I didn't regret it.

dcKyYNEDFF_KIfYe52Yv2g.text: I go here quite often and can't get enough. I love the ambiance and the crew. I always leave full (maybe stuffed!). The only thing is I miss the rotating specials they used to do. I like having the opportunity to try new dishes and the pork dishes were always delicious. Please bring those back!!!

9TBe8xemfNDEG8-Tzf8Kcg.text: Absolutely love Bae Bae Kitchen in Pittsburgh. The restaurant's bubbly decorations alone will bring you. I got the beef bulgogi with glass noodles and it taste amazing. This place reminds me of the Korean food I use to eat at my childhood friend's house growing up. Just really in love with the whole concept. Cant wait to get the Korean Fried Chicken(KFC) next time.

irO2W7QC27U6dG8tsDvsDQ.text: I absolutely adore Bae Bae's! They've got such delicious, fresh food with awesome seasonal offerings. Bae Bae's also has great options for vegetarians and vegans with some of the best tofu in the city. I would seriously eat their tofu for every meal if I could!

Pq9nEP0_cho2nmDsihMUOw.text: Not much to say other than just an excellent Korean place. The menu isn't huge but it's solid. I've tried mostly everything that's served and I've loved it all. Also great bubble tea

LxAwMAbafITpMS1h9KUGag.text: Overwhelmingly delicious. Portions are large, which is wonderful because you'll definitely want to eat the whole thing. I got the spicy chicken with noodles and kimchi, and I was licking my plate clean.   The line was out the door at lunchtime, but service was quick and friendly. I also love the spot's use of biodegradable straws, chopsticks and boxes. Everything aesthetically fits magically together.

gzcPyQkpMXypzqDl8TBNag.text: I love bae baes! I've been her 3 times now and it's always consistently good. The interior is beautiful with plants and it's so clean. My "KFC" chicken is delicious and I love the green sauce that it comes with. The taro bubble tea is also a good go to as well. The cheese wontons are a good side too!

Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. KFC chicken and glass noodles, and on the side I got cheese wontons and Thai bubble Thai Iced Tea

2eGLHLowqeCAJ4Yaz27LIg.text: Came here for lunch on a weekday.  Ordered their glass noodles for the base, with fried tofu, and seaweed salad as my side.  Total was around $13.  What's Hot - Quality.  Yummers!  My fried tofu was nicely seasoned and tasted delicious.  For example, there was plum sauce, which added a nice flavor.  Their glass noodles and salad were good quality and fresh.  Their salad, that came with the dish, had a nice red pepper vinaigrette type of salad dressing, which had a nice tang. - Menu selection.  There are meats, veggies, and vegan selection.  Their fried tofu is a fried yuba (ie: tofu skins, which is thinner and has a nice texture).  They have bulgogi, sweet potato fries, seaweed salad, kimchi, chicken stir fry, etc...  It's pretty good and seasonal.  Their sides aren't the same all the time, because it depends on what they have in season.    - Portions.  It's a good portion size for 1 person.  They're not huge, but they're enough.  They serve all orders in takeout containers, which is nice and helpful if you don't eat there.   - Socially conscious/aware.  They have recycle bins for you to throw away your meal containers, plastic cups, utensils, etc...  It's great having a restaurant be environmentally friendly.  Additionally, any tips are donated.  What's Not - Layout.  It's a small seating area and it's not good for groups.  You can eat there, but it's easier finding seats and/or a table if it's a small group.  They do have a small outdoor seating area.  If your group is 4 or more, good luck.  Their service is geared for take out. - Price.  To be fair, they're not that expensive.  However, their meals only come with 1 side.  Any additional side is $1 each, which is expensive, given the small portions of the side.  As mentioned, my meals was around $13, which isn't bad, but it is kinda pricey for a single meal and no leftovers.  Any additional sides cost extra, as well, and it isn't cheap.  But this place is also more socially conscious, which comes with a price tag. - Wait time.  This place appears pretty popular.  They open at 11:30am and there were already people waiting outside when I arrived.  My point is to be aware that the popularity effects how long you're waiting in line and to get your food.  Final Answer Would definitely come back, but mindful of the time of when to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Base: Glass noodles Dish: Fried tofu (yuba) Side: Seaweed salad
Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

YyYAZQBpnUwcfAC9QA7lNw.text: I was really disappointed on my trip to Bae Bae's. With all the fabulous reviews, I had bookmarked this place to go months ago. We finally made it down this past Friday. There were several events going on downtown so everything was a bit more crowded than usual. However, my hubby still said the line wasn't that long. He is in lines like this during the lunch hour and he is in and out. Unfortunately that was not the case on Friday.  We ordered relatively quickly despite the long line around 6:20pm. We then waited almost 40 min for our food. For a place that really is take out that is ridiculous. They really only rushed on our food after we waited 30 min and my hubby went up to ask the status bc we have a 19 month old that needs to eat. The girl at the front said there were 2 Julia's that ordered. Im really not sure what that meant. Were they confused how much longer? Were they just not feeding anyone named Julia? They then gave us our rice we had ordered for our daughter but we waited an additional 10 minutes for our food.  Honestly I wouldn't be so mad about this if MANY people that came in after us had not come and gone with their food so quickly. We ordered two items that were a special so surely we weren't the only people in 40 minutes time that ordered the special?  Anyways- I ordered the spicy chicken with rice and tempura vegetables. It was good but was definitely super spicy. I'm not sure when or if I will be back due to the bad experience. My hubby keeps saying to give it another try.  I would give 2 stars due to the experience but the good food brought it up a star.

W8k2nab8mSGPomPi3K5cfg.text: Omg. This was so good!   We went in before going into a show one night - the restaurant we were going to go to had way to long of a wait - Bae Bae's was our back up to the back up plan .. but should have been our first choice!  We got the kfc with glass noodles and veggies ... really really good!   I could have eaten just the veggies alone as a meal! If your in town and looking for a good health quick meal - this is definitely a place to try!

ubDJMiJcACeaErnDnhknvw.text: What a great little spot. I love Bae Bae's! All of their food has been fresh and delicious. I can't really say anything bad about them. They always try to have something new on their menu, which I really like. I love their tofu, it's crispy and flavorful, as well as their bulgogi beef. Everything there has great flavor to it. Even the fried rice. I really like that they try to locally source their food and also keep it ethical. I love coming here for lunch, it's close to where I work. Definitely try it, if you haven't. They even have bubble tea, which is a treat!   You can build your own box, as well, and they give you really great sized portions. It's a little pricey for lunch, depending on what you get, but worth it! Everyone who works there is very nice and friendly. And what makes them even better is that they don't accept tips, however, you can make a donation and it all goes to the humane society

4HmPHv2F6hOyT-M3pEsecQ.text: We tried this place for an early lunch last week. The food was all super fresh and flavorful. I had the bulgogi chicken with noodles and kimchi. The kimchi was pretty standard. The noodles had good flavor, but were a little greasy. The chicken was really good, but I hear that the fried chicken is the best option here. I will have to go back and try that sometime soon.   The interior of Bae Bae's is super small, so if you want to sit to eat, you have to be lucky or get there early. Everything already comes in to-go containers, so if you are looking to take something with you, this is a great option too.

LazCSGBu-2VH1PLJW_cpqQ.text: Bae Bae's was good, but not spectacular. I built my own bowl with japchae noodles, bulgogi, greens, and kimchi. I liked the noodles and greens, but I was not a huge fan of the bulgogi. It was very greasy and tasted bland. The kimchi was ok, not the best I've had. I don't really like how they put the food in to go boxes either, it just gives me this weird vibe- like they want you to hurry up and leave or something. I felt kind of rushed while I was eating. I understand that Bae Bae's is a fast casual restaurant, but I wish they had actual plates for guests who want to stay and dine.   The price for the food is somewhat expensive, as it's $13 for mediocre bulgogi. I wasn't highly impressed with Bae Bae's, as it's supposed to be "healthy" but is their definition of "healthy" greasy meat and tempura? I'm not so sure if I want to come back again, but I did enjoy the plants in the restaurant and friendly staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bulgogi and japchae noodles, served with greens and kimchi

bpaTx8Ij25756rAmRQB--A.text: Impressive decor and ambiance of the place. The food can described as a Korean fusion that works well in regards to taste and presentation. There were vegan options which what drew is here. We ordered a Create Your Own bowl/dish with tempura and tofu and plum sauce that includes kimchi and we selected both the rice and noodle base for three orders. The food was good and stood out from the standard Korean food that we all know and love with their own unique twist that experiments with the flavors. I wish they had the salad greens have more flavor like sesame oil and soy sauce or something to make it stand out. A little pricey considering the portion received but it was overall a great experience. I hear the worker singing in the back room as I am writing this review. Glad we were able to try this place while passing through Pittsburg!

Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

QtO3qGMnq2Os19vTJ5RuaA.text: Korean clean food in the city of Pittsburgh. Ordering: Choose your base, I picked jap chae (glass noodle), choose your protein, I picked bulgogi. Choose your side, I picked kimchi.   Food: Balance and delicious, not excessive use of oil. Not salty, not bland, just balance. Feels like you are eating clean food, not the typical Korean restaurants food.   Price: wowee a tad pricier, ordered 2 orders of the plate, 4 pieces of dumpling, and 2 bottles of tea came out to be $40. Great thing about it actually, no tips! They accept donation.   Overall, will definitely go back for healthier choice but not my go to, I like unhealthy stuff.

hRn8kZhe93fMMji_LFj50w.text: The KFC chicken was super crunchy and moist. I had it with a salad. The salad dressing and the wasabi sauce was really good. I also had the cucumber kimchi which was also delicious. Everything was very fresh and seasoned well. The place is so cute and bright. It was a little crowded at lunch time but the line moves pretty fast.

84ASffTM2xAjWlO5buadyw.text: I had a dream about Bae Baes Kitchen the other night. Out of this world good, I have it every time I'm in Pittsburgh!

roiFSp4zBQX942UjDrP6zg.text: One of my favorite spots downtown! Don't go nearly as much as I should. I've never had something I didn't like from here. Everything is fresh & delicious! The KFC is my favorite, especially with the wasabi sauce

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Korean Fried Chicken (KFC) with rice, salad &amp; tempura veggies. Beef Bulgogi with salad. Taro &amp; Thai Iced tea bobas!

lhoIvY0asTLLkYhwVH4TqQ.text: Limited selection compared to Green Pepper, but it was extremely good. I enjoyed the spicy chicken. The cucumber kimchi is what I'd recommend. Very friendly staff.

eHKA40TfIAbgRjCeLyqZvw.text: This is my new favorite place to get a quick meal before a show downtown! The food is good, the space is beautifully decorated with live plants and pictures of flowers, and best of all, the people working there are extremely friendly. I've tried their three different meats now, and my favorite is the bulgogi beef. Highly recommended!

wTygKFZaLL_kewCoTcLlxQ.text: Super cute place with a trendy aesthetic. The wait to order was a little awkward, but the staff was very friendly.  I tried their rice, tofu, and sprouts and was pretty satisfied overall! I've never had tofu prepared that way and although it tasted good it was a little cumbersome to eat. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a tasty vegetarian or vegan meal.

X_Suj46_dsjdQMb1ocD9CQ.text: Long story short - Amazing authentic food and great service, go eat there. As a Korean working in Pittsburgh for a project, I didn't expect to be able to get my Korean food fix downtown but I go to this place at least once every week for lunch. As regulars, my coworkers and I have tried most of their options and are never unsatisfied. They've changed some menu items after the new year and I'm even more excited! For people trying it out for the first time, I'd definitely recommend the noodles and either the beef or chicken option. Their fried chicken is always perfectly crispy and the honey-wasabi sauce that comes with it is amazing. They've also come out with a new braised short rib option that just seems to melt in your mouth. All their side dishes are great too - I love their napa and cucumber kimchi because it tastes like it was really made by loving Korean cooks ~ The people there care about all of their customers, the space is quaint but wonderfully decorated, their beverage options are also awesome (try their bubble tea!) and their portions are generous. They always give you complimentary tempura with the plates, which are also always perfectly fried. The service might be a tad bit slow but it's worth it to support a local business and eat some authentic Korean food. Thanks, bae bae -

rCxF-WTDEcA6ZF0lFLYUSQ.text: Great food and fast service.  I've had the bulgolgi, pork belly, and Korean fried chicken.   All tasty.  The Napa cabbage kim chi is tasty and bearable. Not as spicy as I'm used to. Definitely Korean-inspired, but good food.  The typical box lunch will run you $12-$15 with good sized portions.  First place I've been in that gas a donation in place of tips concept. Staff has always been friendly even when the line is backed out the door and down the street.  If it is backed out, don't be nervous.  The line moves quickly because of the counter food display set up.

QVL0zdLTBqYpB0hUoOAgyA.text: Amazing vibe and food is legit! Ordered glass noodles, KFC,and cucumber kimchi. Came with small order of sweet potato tempura. Very cool that they don't accept tips- only donations to humane society!

photos.caption: Photo of Bae Bae's Kitchen - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

FIFdB4yWyvBP6LiuQSeVOg.text: I had heard a lot of positive buzz from the comedians who perform next door at Arcade Comedy Theater that Bae Bae's food was delicious and service was great. I finally got the chance to stop in for lunch last week and man, they were right. KFC, jap chae, cucumber kimchi were all super fresh, flavorful, and tasty. Great, quick service even with a bit of a line. The space couldn't be sweeter; sitting in the window withe my friend, watching people walk by and admiring all their plants was a lovely way to spend the lunch hour. Can't wait to come back.

YsJL2ERFRZWyBgsfAAcL_w.text: Visiting out of town from Kentucky for a conference. It was good and the people were nice.

nYARzukY_CP0admbDxZzdw.text: Stopped by while I was visiting Pittsburgh and I'm glad I did. A little pricey for a lunch but worth every bite and was super filling! I had the bowl with the Korean fried chicken (not your drumstick fare with beer on the side) which was a fried fillet. The meal came with wasabi dressing which was something I never knew I needed, so good but don't underestimate the spice (it's still wasabi with a kick). The owners were sweet and if I'm ever back in Pittsburgh I will be here again.

QrilcXWn_W_ufyCT3QHthQ.text: quite delicious! and its environment is lovely and sweet! but you have to wait 5-10 mins.

PdP1i34Q0Z4LtO7uGqDEHw.text: Fast food under heat lamp.  Not really authentic Korean food but I guess it the best you can get in the mid-west.  Good hospitality.

NpdPwwwL2-w_u1vgP1OhIg.text: One of the best Asian restaurants I've ever eaten at. They need to expand - the food is amazing. The chicken and the tofu are both so good. Highly recommend!

oU7YKve7c-paxZyEJiAPbQ.text: The food was fine but not great, but an entree and bubble tea cost me twenty dollars and for that price i expected far more. For that price i could have gone to a sit-down restaurant and ordered something far better, or taken the bus to oakland to get korean there. Portion sizes for rice and side salad were good but the meat portion was comparatively small, again, especially for the price. I think i also caught the end of a batch and so it had been sitting out for a while, which maybe didn't help the available portion or the flavor. I really love Korean, and wanted to love this place, but i was just disappointed. Don't see myself coming back.

apd2r7UgP-MDbzRItBb7Pw.text: Their fried sweet potatoes are awesome. Korean beef is also very good and has a nice flavor. Their kimchi and other side dishes are wonderful. The staff are friendly and the quality of the food is well worth the price. It's hard to find good restaurants who value organic and high quality food as much as they do, not to mention an Asian restaurant too.

eWHSA1Fk-dd62mBePw1NKQ.text: Awesome lunch!  Everything is fresh, people are friendly and the food is unbelievably good.

9foRMHn54ht79IDT37XRBw.text: I have to say, the environment of this place is dope, but it's really pricy. As an Asian, the food tastes just like Asian fusion fast food. We order a lot of food, including KFC chicken rice combo and noodles beef combo, miso soup, hot tea and sweet potato tempura. Totally 37.45 dollars! The seaweed salad is not seaweed! It mixes with cucumber, green pepper and carrots. Tell me where is seaweed? A normal camomile tea three dollars!? Miso soup tastes like the soup you can make by yourself. Chicken got no flavor in. I don't know why they call it KFC chicken... The waitress is super nice. The only thing makes me feel better.

YYueKJIDak4TffYPanH-iw.text: The perfect winter work lunch: it's comfort food that doesn't make you feel like you need a nap or a long run immediately afterward. I have tried both bulgogi and the bbq pork belly (each excellent). For sides: the Kimchi is my clear favorite. The service here is fantastic. Lines can get long (because word is spreading about how good it is) but the staff are always friendly and quick. And sometimes they offer little extras with your meal. Today the cashier asked if I liked sweet drinks and gave me a free sweet tea to enjoy. It's on the higher end for me pricewise for a fast casual spot but I think for the quality of ingredients, taste, and all of the different things you're getting (protein, carb, salad, side, tempura veggie) it's totally worth it.

zvMmvL1SsAtkU5PWZlSJ8g.text: Aesthetic: Small and cozy.  The decorations and lighting feels more like a hipster coffee shop than a restaurant, but it is aesthetically pleasing.    Ordering and wait times:  We went at an off time and there was a minimal wait.  Once, placing the order the food took 5 - 10 mins, which is reasonable, but longer than I thought considering the food was already out infront.   Taste:  Food was clean and not overpowering.  They avoided the typical pitfall of every other Korean restaurants in Pittsburgh and restaurants in general of overseasoning the food.  We had the spicy crab kimbab with soft tofu and a bowl with japchae and fried tofu.  Both were tasty, but would not recommend if you are looking for a authentic korean food experience.  Regardless, food tastes good.    Price: Slightly on the pricey side, but given location and organic sourcing prices are fair and expected.    Overall:  Would return and recommend.  First, Korean restaurant in Pittsburgh area that I would want to return to.

sGuziVkz11LNUxyZi-1RmA.text: this place is amazing! very vegan/veg friendly! i got the tofu with glass noodles, it was big enough for my partner and i to split! holy hell it was delicious! bulgogi is super hard to find vegan, this spot blew my mind. very reasonably priced, a small and  family business really trying to show their beautiful style of cooking. you won't regret it!

3viwdrzzfKPnucUaJu25sw.text: The food is so good!  I'd eat here every night of the week if I could. The atmosphere is charming - casual and relaxing.

s_QYbMq0_UvrjQy5C99OZw.text: Bae Bae's has great food atmosphere and location. The spicy chicken and noodles were excellent. The bathrooms and kitchen are spicy clean. The green house garden is very interesting. Highly recommend this spot for a good eating experience.
